recent.comments: Michel and Stephane’s place was a perfect base to explore Avignon with easy access to many beautiful towns and villages in this part of Provence.  A stunning home… stylish, large and peaceful with spectacular views.  Michel and Stephane went way and beyond being perfect hosts and their communication and attention to detail with everything first class.  Thank you for a truly memorable stay.

items.comments: Michel and Stephane’s place was a perfect base to explore Avignon with easy access to many beautiful towns and villages in this part of Provence.  A stunning home… stylish, large and peaceful with spectacular views.  Michel and Stephane went way and beyond being perfect hosts and their communication and attention to detail with everything first class.  Thank you for a truly memorable stay.

Michel and Stephane were very helpful, attentive and quick to respond. Their recommendations were spot on! Château Le Cigales is more beautiful than the photos! The views of Avignon from the apartment are amazing ? The apartment had everything we needed. We had a wonderful time! Definitely worth a second visit.

Our stay was wonderful—the location and the AirBnB were incredible. Michel and Stéphane were very kind and helpful. We had everything we needed, and they had lots of great recommendations. The bed was also the most comfortable one we slept in on our entire trip! There is a bakery and a pharmacy that are walkable from the château. Walking to the Avignon city center is also possible—about 30 minutes, but it’s better to take a car if it’s hot. The grounds were lovely and the view was amazing. We hope to come back here many times! Thank you!

Our hosts met us at the door and showed us through the Apartment. It was spotlessly clean and spacious with an amazing view looking onto Avignon from main room. Great bed and bathroom; lovely little private terrace off the kitchen; and easy parking. Stephane and Michel were warm and welcoming and made a number of helpful suggestions and recommendations for how we spend our time and places for us  to eat at. Highly recommended as it was one of the best stays of our trip.

Michel’s place, right outside of Avignon, was the perfect place for a little bit of rest and recuperation after touring Avignon and Provence. The view is amazing and Michel and Stephane were very welcoming and delightful. Would definitely stay there again if given the opportunity.

If you are looking for a perfect location to explore Provence, Michel’s wonderful apartment is your choice. It is exquisitely decorated and impeccably clean. The setting is so beautiful, a chateau up on a hill overlooking Avignon. Michel was so helpful to us throughout our stay, assisting us with dinner reservations and providing us with local information on all the areas we visited. He is a kind, welcoming host. We hope to return to Michel’s apartment with our daughter and granddaughter some time in the future.

description.summary:
Discover the charm of this luxury apartment on the 1st floor of a 19th century castle in the heart of a vast wooded park.
Admire the exceptional view of the Palais des Papes in Avignon and its surroundings.
Calm and tranquility surrounded by greenery.

Located in Villeneuve les Avignon and 5 minutes by car from the historic center of Avignon, you can discover all the authentic charm of the villages and Provençal landscapes in the surroundings.
description.space:
Very bright 100 m2 apartment with terrace, 3 bedrooms and a fully equipped kitchen for your comfort: conventional oven, microwave oven, induction hob and hood, large fridge with freezer, filter coffee maker and Nespresso coffee machine, toaster and kettle, as well as all the dishes and utensils for cooking. It is also equipped with a dishwasher and a washing machine.
The living room, dining room and the 2 main bedrooms are air-conditioned. You will find at your disposal an ironing board and an iron.
For our littlest travelers a cot, a baby bath, a changing mat and a high chair are provided.
You can park your vehicle at the foot of the castle and enjoy a vast wooded park.
From the living room and the dining room you will love the breathtaking view of the Palais des Papes and Avignon...

Local bus lines nearby.
Near Avignon TGV station and central station.
50 minutes by car from Marseille-Provence airport.
description.notes:
Household linen provided: sheets, towels and tea towels.
Tourist documents.
Wifi internet and desk with computer available.
Possibility to order a gourmet basket of local specialties for your first evening at the Château.
description.neighborhood: Situé à Villeneuve-les-Avignon, à 5 min en voiture du centre historique d'Avignon, cet appartement historique permet de partir aisément à la découverte du charme authentique des villages et des paysages provençaux.
description.transit:
Lignes de bus locales à proximité.
Proche gare TGV Avignon et gare centre.
50 minutes en voiture de l'aéroport de Marseille-Provence.
description.interaction: Owners also live in the castle within a condominium.
description.house_rules:
Fumeurs autorisés sur la terrasse.
Les personnes qui fumeraient à l'intérieur se verront appliquer un forfait de 500€ pour le nettoyage complet de l'appartement.

description.summary:
Charming 17th century Barn conversion. Restored with every attention to detail, abundance of character & exposed beams, fully fitted kitchen, attractive bathroom with roll top bath & rain shower. Underfloor heating, High Speed Wifi and Smart TV. 

Just 14 minutes from Gatwick Airport/Station & the Express into London takes only 30 minutes, yet the Barn is set in open countryside, surrounded by fields, on an Equestrian property. 

Hot tub available to hire at additional £40 per day/night.
description.space:
Old Barn Cottage is a 17th century timbered converted Barn in the grounds of our 1630 Listed Farmhouse, perfect for escaping to the country, racing at Lingfield or visiting  London and Brighton are amongst many of the great attractions this area has to offer. Old Barn Cottage is situated on an Equestrian property at the end of a quiet, no through country lane.

THE ACCOMMODATION
Sleeps a maximum of 4 and comprises of, ground floor fully fitted open plan kitchen/living room with underfloor heating, breakfast bar, dishwasher, fridge, kettle, toaster and Nespresso coffee maker. 
L shaped Sofa, additional sofa and coffee table. There is also a downstairs utility room with WC and washer/dryer. The stairs to the next level open up to a vaulted ceiling with more exposed beams where you will find two double bedrooms and bathroom with shower, roll top bath, WC, basin heated towel rail and hair dryer. All bed linen, towels, shampoo and shower gel etc are provided. The property is self catering with a complimentary selection of teas, coffee, herbs, spices and cooking oil etc available for your use. The village of Smallfield, just a mile up the road has a Co-op, Butchers and Greengrocers  if required.

HOT TUB
There is a Hot tub available, situated on the patio of the main farmhouse (50 yards from the cottage) that can be hired on request.  A daily charge of £40 applies which can be invoiced through Airbnb in advance. Please enquire.

Great local pubs and restaurants less than a mile away and lots of lovely country walks from your doorstep.

THE AREA
We might be just 30 miles from London, but we are in the heart of South-East England, surrounded by some of the most beautiful and richly historic landscapes in the country. Midway between the Surrey Hills area of outstanding natural beauty, the High Weald area of natural beauty & the South Downs National Park, there’s no shortage of natural attractions to explore. Rural location, car recommended.

Due to the close proximity to Gatwick there is some aircraft noise - perfect for any avid plane spotters!

Airport parking available while you are away on holiday.  Daily rate applies.
Accessible by car, the local railway stations are:
THREE BRIDGES TRAIN STATION - 6.7 mile (17min) Direct line to  London and Brighton.
GATWICK AIRPORT - 6.3 mile (14 min) also, direct train line to London and Brighton.
LINGFIELD RACECOURSE - 5 mile (11 min) also direct train train line to London.
Within easy reach of the South-east coast and the Channel Tunnel.
Taxis to/from Gatwick are easily accessible and cost around £23 (including airport drop off fee) for a regular sized car.

items.comments: Great base for playing golf courses in the area.

Comfortable and cosy property. Spotlessly clean. Lovely bed linen and towels. Powerful shower and big bath. Close to some great pubs. Harvey sent clear instructions to find the property. Would recommend.
Excellent property for exploring Northumberland
Beautiful and cosy accommodation. Plenty of space and very private in a lovely location. Great communication from hosts and had everything we needed.

Lovely clean and modern  accommodation . We only stayed 2 nights but could have easily stayed for longer. It was in a  perfect central location for visiting Northumberland beautiful beaches and castles .

What a fantastic place, great hosts and the cottage was amazing. Everything we needed and to a very high standard. We just had an amazing time, certainly would visit again. Many thanks Harvey and Carole.

description.summary:
Sit in the private, sunny garden area and take in the magnificent views over the ancient CoquetValley. Rejuvenate in the pool, sauna, gym, and hot tub at nearby Linden Hall Hotel, Membership for two guests is inclusive with the stay. 
Explore beautiful beaches, historic castles and wonderful countryside and end the day by a log-burning stove in the lounge. During the summer months enjoy a glass of wine or a BBQ in the pretty cottage garden. Our comfortable converted barn is the perfect base to explore the coast and countryside of Northumberland.

Comfortable and stylish living room/kitchen with working log burner. (photos were taken before the flue was fitted)  Well equipped kitchen area with dishwasher, washing machine, fridge freezer and granite work surfaces. 
Lovely kingsized bedroom, oak flooring, quality linen and towels supplied with complimentary toiletries . Pretty country style bathroom with bath and shower over.
Children are very welcome and we can supply a cot (no linen) and a high chair for babies, a z- bed with linen for older children is available at no extra charge.
There is a very comfortable sofa bed with a pocket sprung mattress in the living area which will sleep 2 adults for the odd night or a short break.
One well behaved dog welcome £10 extra charge

Guests have their own private garden and west facing seating area and access to plenty of parking.
There is also an extra lawned area separate from the owners garden if they wish to use it for BBQ or children playing
Free membership for 4 guests (adults or children) at the nearby Linden Hall Hotel for the spa and leisure club is available for guests during their stay.
There is a swimming pool, sauna, a small gym and hot tub and there are often some discounts on spa treatments.
There is also a golf club but this is not included in the membership and green fees apply.

We want our guests to have their privacy but are friendly and welcoming and happy to help and provide information during their stay.

Swallowtails barn is in a farming hamlet outside the pretty village of Longframlington. 
There are lovely country walks on the doorstep
Take an easy stroll to reach good pubs serving food an award-winning grocery shop, artisan bakery and coffee shop. Then drive along pretty winding lanes to explore the beautiful beaches and villages on the Northumberland coast.
Visit historic castles at Alnwick and Bamburgh or spend a day at nearby Cragside Hall and gardens
 Excellent butchers also in village

There is plenty of parking on site.
It is an easy walk to the village, taking about 15 minutes and there is a local taxi available operated by one of the neighbours which can be very useful. Regular buses run to Alnwick and Morpeth
There is a mainline station at Alnmouth approx 10 -15 mins drive

Swallowtails is adjoining the owners property but has its own separate entrance garden and seating area.
There is friendly dog on site

description.summary:
Head out on Angles Way and follow the Waveney river valley for an idyllic countryside stroll or take a trip to the beautiful Suffolk coast, then light the fire and curl up under the beams. Featured in a host of magazines, this bucolic abode combines period features and chic, contemporary design.

Ivywood cottage is medieval in age, but contemporary in design, with luxurious finishes and fine detailing.   

The house is in a unique rural setting and was once part of the Gawdy Hall Estate.

The house sits next to a beautiful 15th century church, set within a 3 acre church yard.

Glorious and plentiful Waveney Valley walks in all directions.

Guests have complete privacy and run of the house, including a private garden.

We respect our guest's privacy, and are on call for any advice or assistance that you may need during your visit.

The cottage is a short picturesque drive from the coastal gems of Southwold and Aldeburgh. Harleston and Bungay are quintessential English towns with charming independent stores, delis, family butchers, bistro cafes, pubs, restaurants, and tea shops.

It's the countryside, most people drive.

Diss is the mainline station between London and Norwich and is just 15 minutes by car.

Cycling is very popular and the cottage is on a regular time trial route.

Buses are very reliable and the village is well serviced making it easy to hop between Suffolk and Norfolk villages.

There is fabulous walking from the cottage. Located in the Waveney Valley paths such as Angles Way which follows the Waveney river valley are right on your doorstep.

name: Remarkable 17th-Century House with a Terrace Lap Pool
title: Goult, France

hosts.about:
For over 30 years, the space Xavier Nicod continues the ongoing search for the object as a work, whether popular or valuable. That is, each time, a search of harmony and beauty that splint the wildest and most timeless projects. Through his creations, home, garden, hotel, shop or event, Xavier Nicod shaping the scene plays on the contrast of cultures and meaning, by daring to overcome the limitations of conventional decorative aesthetics.

With the desire to share his universe, Xavier Nicod opened in September 2017 its guest rooms in Provence, in a discreet and authentic village of Luberon, places where nature and selected objects are used to sample the audacity, beauty and poetry as a way of life.

Depuis plus de 30 ans, l’espace Xavier Nicod poursuit la recherche permanente de l’objet comme une oeuvre, qu’il soit populaire ou précieux. C’est, à chaque fois, une quête d’harmonie et d’esthétique qui s’attelle aux projets les plus fous et les plus intemporels. A travers ses créations, maison, jardin, hôtel, boutique ou événement, Xavier Nicod façonne les lieux, joue sur le contraste des cultures et du sens, en osant dépasser les limites de l’esthétique décorative conventionnelle.

Avec l'envie de partager son univers, Xavier Nicod a ouvert en septembre 2017 ses chambres d'hôtes en Provence, dans un village discret et authentique du Luberon, des lieux où la nature  et les objets sélectionnés permettent de goûter à l'audace, la beauté et la poésie comme un art de vivre.

recent.comments:
Ouvrez la porte de ce joyau et laissez vous transporter par la
Magie des lieux .
Ce que propose Xavier n’est pas un logement c’est un enchantement .
Tout mène à la rêverie : le calme absolu des lieux, le goût raffiné de Xavier, le charme de Goult, et la cerise sur le gâteau c’est le jardin luxuriant paysager et le bassin de nage .
Bref, je suis encore toute émue par tant de beauté .
Sans oublier la sympathie inégalée de Xavier

items.comments:
Ouvrez la porte de ce joyau et laissez vous transporter par la
Magie des lieux .
Ce que propose Xavier n’est pas un logement c’est un enchantement .
Tout mène à la rêverie : le calme absolu des lieux, le goût raffiné de Xavier, le charme de Goult, et la cerise sur le gâteau c’est le jardin luxuriant paysager et le bassin de nage .
Bref, je suis encore toute émue par tant de beauté .
Sans oublier la sympathie inégalée de Xavier

Art Déco- oder Brocant-Wohnung - beides passt für dieses Schmuckstück. Die Wohnung ist verspielt und passt sehr gut in das Konzept von Xavier! Der kleine Balkon der Wohnung ist ein Traum. Die Sicht auf die alte Mühle von Goult ... (zum Schmelzen). Die Lage ist absolut ruhig. Ausser einem Pfau den man ab und zu beim Château de Goult sehen, kann hört man nichts. Der Indoor-Pool muss man selber erleben. Die ganze Anlage ist wie ein Brocant in "L'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue". 

Xavier ist ein super lieber Typ. Immer für einen Spass zu haben. Die Wohnung können wir allen empfehlen, die offen für neues sind. Wir kommen wieder!

Es ist eine wunderbare, kreative Ferienanlage, die über Jahrzehnte in einem alten provenzialischen Steinhaus gewachsen ist. Goult ist eine sehr schöne kleine, authentische Stadt in der Provenz, in der es alles gibt, was man zum guten Leben braucht. Von hier aus kann man perfekt alle Sehenswürdigkeiten des Luberon erkunden. Xavier ist wie ein guter hilfsbereiter Geist. Wir haben uns rundum wohl geführt. Danke Xavier!
Xavier’s place more than met our expectations! Xavier greeted us upon arrival and made us feel right at home.  We had a relaxing weekend and wish we stayed longer. My boyfriend and I will be back!

It is not possible to be better welcome than Xavier did for us. He was enthusiastic, friendly, available with big sense of details.
Xavier’s AirBnB is already on the top of our list for next year vacations. The house is an experience by itself, made with lot of taste, peaceful… We should have stayed longer !!!6 stars out of 5. 🤩

Xavier est un hôte accueillant et sympathique.

Ses appartements sont bien pensés afin de faciliter la vie et les vacances de ses hôtes.

Emplacement idéal au cœur de Goult.

Je recommande

description.summary:
Revel in the otherworldly ambiance of this remodeled 17th-century home eclectically adorned with antique furnishings, whimsical decor, and magical curios. Guests are welcome to use the owner's 12-meter-lap-pool, shared with his 3 other rentals, situated in his unique calm closed magic garden.

The entrance from the street leads you through a closed stone walled  sunny patio with a table and chairs for outside eating, as well as 2 sun-loungers into the bright colourful open well equipped kitchen integrated in the dining room, all with a cheery, vintage vibe. 

(The patio is also used by the other guests as a right of passage to access their apartment and the shared lap pool.)

From there a spiral wood staircase leads you up to the bedroom with wood floors and a fireplace, a terrace with a great view over to the windmill, the top point of the village and an antique romantic outside bathtub. The night sky full of stars is famous in the Provence, if you’re lucky you catch a full moon.

The toilet is located on the same level as the kitchen/dining room and is separated from the shower which you find on the level below in the basement, tiled in sea green Moroccan zelliges.

You also find your own washing machine for clothes in the basement.

The character of the house, the architecture as well as the interior decoration is full of original antiques and vintage pieces, carefully selected by the owner and has an absolute unique handwriting. It will appeal to everyone who loves an aesthetically unique and novel experience.

Parking:
You can unload your baggage at the house and park you car free of charge a one minute's walk away on the convenient public parking of the village.

Linen, Pool Towels:
all included

Information about Goult and the Area: 

At the heart of the „Triangle D’Or“, Goult makes an ideal base for exploring the many surrounding villages, as well as larger towns such as Avignon, Aix-en- Provence and Marseille, all within 15 mins to 1hr30mins' drive away.

All amenities, restaurants, bar, coffee places, the famous 'Cafe de la poste‘, groceries, bakery, butcher, fromagerie, market on thursday with regional products, as well as a couple of little shops with local handmade art, regional products and antiques are all one-minute’s walk away to be explored.

Walks up to the windmill, the castle, the church through the little peaceful winding streets of the village as well as gorgeous walks directly from the village into the beautiful nature, eg. natural terrasses, views, lavender fields and partly through light forests are highly recommended.

Electronic bicycles are possible to be rented in Coustellet or Apt to discover the surrounding area.

Additionally you can visit the owners 'Borie‘, an original habitation by the rural population of the region in the ancient times, where you can have your picnic. Covers to sit on are lent by the owner for that occasion. The 'Borie‘ is a 5 mins walk away.

Guests are welcome to use the owner’s 12-meter lap-pool, situated in the quiet and secluded magic adjoining owner's garden.

This absolutely unique garden will offer you an exceptional memorable souvenir, welcoming you to use all amenities available such as 2 relaxing lay matts surrounded by trees to cover you with the necessary shadow, a daybed hidden in a vaulted corner by the pool as well as a rocking chair with a shower in another vaulted alcove by the pool. There are little terraces to be wandered around and a table with chairs to have your meal in that paradise.

I live next-door, and are happy to answer your questions and offer suggestions if needed.

Goult is known by the locals as the hidden village of the Luberon and is appreciated for its pleasant, authentic atmosphere. There are several charming restaurants in the heart of the village, as well as the lively Café de la Poste on the main square.

You can unload your baggage at the house and park you car free of charge a one minute walk away on the convenient public parking of the village.

GOOD TO KNOW
ABOUT YOUR TRIP TO  GOULT

A 2 days stay at Goult is a minimum, ideal would be 4 days or more.

Reservations at the restaurants in Goult and the Luberon are necessary. 
The restaurants  are often fully booked 1 or 2 weeks ahead.
Think of reserving ahead of time !!!

For cooking at home, all my 3 apartments have well equipped kitchens. 
Coffee and tee are provided.

description.space:
The entrance from the street leads you through a closed stone walled  sunny patio with a table and chairs for outside eating, as well as 2 sun-loungers into the bright colourful open well equipped kitchen integrated in the dining room, all with a cheery, vintage vibe. 

(The patio is also used by the other guests as a right of passage to access their apartment and the shared lap pool.)

From there a spiral wood staircase leads you up to the bedroom with wood floors and a fireplace, a terrace with a great view over to the windmill, the top point of the village and an antique romantic outside bathtub. The night sky full of stars is famous in the Provence, if you’re lucky you catch a full moon.

The toilet is located on the same level as the kitchen/dining room and is separated from the shower which you find on the level below in the basement, tiled in sea green Moroccan zelliges.

You also find your own washing machine for clothes in the basement.

The character of the house, the architecture as well as the interior decoration is full of original antiques and vintage pieces, carefully selected by the owner and has an absolute unique handwriting. It will appeal to everyone who loves an aesthetically unique and novel experience.

Parking:
You can unload your baggage at the house and park you car free of charge a one minute's walk away on the convenient public parking of the village.

Linen, Pool Towels:
all included

Information about Goult and the Area: 

At the heart of the „Triangle D’Or“, Goult makes an ideal base for exploring the many surrounding villages, as well as larger towns such as Avignon, Aix-en- Provence and Marseille, all within 15 mins to 1hr30mins' drive away.

All amenities, restaurants, bar, coffee places, the famous 'Cafe de la poste‘, groceries, bakery, butcher, fromagerie, market on thursday with regional products, as well as a couple of little shops with local handmade art, regional products and antiques are all one-minute’s walk away to be explored.

Walks up to the windmill, the castle, the church through the little peaceful winding streets of the village as well as gorgeous walks directly from the village into the beautiful nature, eg. natural terrasses, views, lavender fields and partly through light forests are highly recommended.

Electronic bicycles are possible to be rented in Coustellet or Apt to discover the surrounding area.

Additionally you can visit the owners 'Borie‘, an original habitation by the rural population of the region in the ancient times, where you can have your picnic. Covers to sit on are lent by the owner for that occasion. The 'Borie‘ is a 5 mins walk away.

name: The Dovecote — Collins Farm
title: Bristol, UK

recent.comments: The cottage was clean and crisp and set in a beautiful and peaceful location. Very easy access to both Bath and Bristol. Highly recommended.

items.comments: The cottage was clean and crisp and set in a beautiful and peaceful location. Very easy access to both Bath and Bristol. Highly recommended.
Un posto curato nei minimi dettagli pieno di calore e fascino. Pulitissimo. Spero un giorno di poter tornare

Lovely little spot, has everything you could need a for little weekend away and only a short drive into Bristol or Bath. 

Both Sophie and Charlie are super friendly too, would definitely recommend! :)

A beautiful, peaceful location with great views from the bedroom window. Adult daughter loved the mezzanine bed. Surprisingly spacious, simple, stylish decor with everything you need (especially the lovely eggs) to settle in and relax. Perfect location to explore Bath and surrounding area. Would thoroughly recommend and look forward to a return visit in the future.

The cottage was beautiful, clean, and very very comfortable. We loved the outdoor living space, which was perfect to enjoy the breezy weather . The lock was a little bit confusing but fun to figure out. Other than that the dovecote was amazing!
Petite maison accueillante pour 2 ou 3 personnes,  endroit calme. Proche de Bath.

description.summary:
Look out onto open fields from the main bedroom, while French doors lead to a private patio. This detached converted dovecote features vaulted ceilings and original walls of pale local stone, with a Smart TV for cosy evenings in.

The beautiful city of Bath with its 18th century Georgian architecture, original Roman baths and impressive abbey is just 8 miles away. A nearby park and ride service into the town centre operates every 15 minutes. The vibrant city of Bristol, famous for its maritime history and wealth of designer shops, bars and restaurants is also close by - approximately 11 miles from Abson. Other points of interest within an hour’s drive include Glastonbury, Wells, Stonehenge and Longleat Safari Park. Local shops, pubs and dining can be found in the neighbouring villages of Wick and Pucklechurch - each less than 1½ miles away. Shops and pubs 1½ miles.

4 steps to entrance.

Ground Floor:
Open plan living space: With French doors leading to patio.
Living area: With electric wood burner and Smart TV.
Dining area.
Kitchen area: With electric cooker, microwave, fridge and dishwasher.

First Floor:
Bedroom 1: With double bed, vaulted ceiling, beams and en-suite with bath and toilet.
Paddle stairs to...
Bedroom 2: Galleried with single bed and sloping ceiling. This is on a mezzanine level and looks down on to the double bed.

Electric central heating, electricity, bed linen, towels and Wi-Fi included. Welcome pack. Enclosed patio with garden furniture. Bike store. Private parking for 2 cars. No smoking.

Located in the quiet hamlet of Abson, The Dovecote is less than 8 miles away from Bath. A regular park-and-ride service into Bath is just 10 minutes away. Bristol is only a little further, with local shops, pubs, and restaurants in the neighbouring villages of Wick and Pucklechurch.

The farm is not available for guests to wander around as other private residences are situated on site.

name: Faça uma escapadela romântica num moinho de charme na Arrábida.
title: Setúbal, Portugal

gallery.caption: Autenticidade e decoração simples no interior do moinho.
Detalhe da mesinha de cabeceira, sempre com flores frescas do jardim.

O teto do moinho tem forma de cone  invertido.  O espaço superior é atravessado pelo eixo e as vigas em madeira. A janela de sótão que fica por cima da cama tem um estore para proporcionar uma obscuridade total ao quarto.
Quarto com as vigas em madeira e "entrosga" originais do moinho.
Quarto. A mosquiteira, colocada entre o eixo, as vigas e a cama, proporciona um ambiente romântico no interior do moinho.

Quarto.  Detalhe da decoração. Corrimão da escada que desce para a mezzanine e a sala.
O moinho está construido em 3 alturas sobre o rês-do-chão.
Vista desde a janela do quarto orientada para o Sul... podemos ver a Península de Troia, a Baía de Setúbal e a imensidade do Oceano Atlântico.
O Moinho do Marco foi construído em 1855.  Encontra-se localizado no parque natural da Arrábida, Setúbal, PT e conta com uma vista privilegiada sobre a Foz do Rio Sado.
A kitchenette é pequena, mas completamente equipada.
A kitchenette é pequena mas põe à sua dispor tudo o que pode precisar: tachos, panelas, pratos, talheres, chávenas... dispõe ainda duma máquina Nespresso, exaustor, frigorífico, microondas e varinha.
Descida desde a sala para a casa de banho.  A TV fica atrás do quadro com o mapa da Arrábida.
Sala de estar com sofás, mantinhas, ar-condicionado/aquecimento, TV satélite, coluna BT, livros, jogos de mesa...
Mesa de refeições junto à escada em pedra de acesso ao quarto.
Sala e saída ao terraço com a vista de tirar o fôlego sobre a baía de Setúbal.
Deslumbrante vista da península de Tróia desde a porta do moinho.
Todos os recantos são aproveitados no interior do moinho.
A porta da entrada principal está virada a sul, onde se encontra o terraço.
Sala, zona de refeições, cozinha e escadas para o quarto.  No fundo, descida para a casa de banho.

O moinho tem uma escada em pedra com corrimões para ir desde a sala de estar até a mezzanine e para o quarto.
Não é recomendado a pessoas com problemas de mobilidade.
Flores do jardim no coração do moinho.
A casa de banho foi excavada na rocha, encontra-se a um nível mais baixo do rés-do-chão.  Foi modernizada com microcimento.  Possui iluminação natural através de tragaluzes no tecto.
Mezzanine... é o cantinho de leitura, onde pode instalar-se confortavelmente ler, trabalhar ou de conversa!

Mezzanine, o cantinho de leitura.
Livros à sua dispor! deixe um livro e leve outro à sua escolha!
Situação da mezzanine respeito à porta de entrada.  Foto tirada desde a escada para o quarto.
Relaxe neste acolhedor cantinho na mezzanine do moinho.  O local perfeito para ler, conversar ou beber um chá.
Painel de azulejos típico português.
A porta principal tem uma placa que foi colocada na data da construção do moinho, 29 Setembro 1855
Uma refeição qualquer com esta vista é um luxo imbatível.
Sossego envolvente com sons da natureza...
Pequeno-almoço para dois, ao sol no terraço.
Relax...

Terraço do moinho com vista.  
Esquerda: churrasco privado.
Presenciar o nascer do sol no terraço do Moinho do Marco é uma experiência maravilhosa.
Portão de entrada ao Moinho do Marco desde a rua.
Partilhar o  luar no terraço do Moinho do Marco numa noite calma, a ver passar alguns barcos pela Baía, em boa companhia... poucas coisas conseguem igualar este instante de calma e romantismo!
Os nossos hóspedes têm acesso à lavandaria para lavar à sua roupa e à casa de banho existente no jardim.

Churrasco privativo com bancada em pedra e pia com água corrente.
A mesa do alpendre é uma mó utilizada  há muitos anos no Moinho do Marco.
Churrasco privativo.  Bancada em pedra e pia com água... vista imensa sobre Tróia e o Atlántico.
Vista frontal do Moinho do Marco e do terraço.  Atrás, a Serra de São Luís.

Situação do Moinho do Marco na Arrábida.
A 5 minutos de carro para a cidade, o mercado de livramento, supermercados, restaurantes, praias, etc.
Localização do Moinho do Marco frente ao Estuário do Sado.

Localização do Moinho do Marco vista desde o mar; perto do Forte de São Filipe.
Praia da fotografia: Albarquel.
Montanhas do fundo: Serra de São Luís.

hosts.about:
Feliz esposa y madre de 3 hijos que son lo mejor de nuestra vida.  
Nacida en España, casada con un maravilloso francés y viviendo en Setúbal hace años... 
No podría vivir sin sol, no podría sin las pequeñas cosas del día a día, no podría vivir si no existieran esas comidas culminadas con una eterna sobremesa compartida con amigos y buena conversación, si no se hubiera inventado el vino creo que yo por lo menos, lo hubiera intentado,  y por supuesto mi familia... ¡eso sí que me da vida!
Como anfitriona intento que nuestros huéspedes se sientan cómodos, libres, bien acogidos, independientes y generar la suficiente confianza como para que puedan acercarse a mi puerta diciendo ... "Guadalupe, ¿me darías un diente de ajo, por favor?" ¡por supuestooooo! :)

recent.comments:
Nous avons adoré notre séjour. Tout était parfait, quel bel endroit!! Une vue magnifique, un accueil parfait, et l’habitions incroyable!!! 
Un séjour hors du temps, exactement ce que je voulais!! Un des plus beaux endroits où je suis aller et je penses même le meilleur. Merci Guadalupe!!😊🇨🇦

items.comments:
Nous avons adoré notre séjour. Tout était parfait, quel bel endroit!! Une vue magnifique, un accueil parfait, et l’habitions incroyable!!! 
Un séjour hors du temps, exactement ce que je voulais!! Un des plus beaux endroits où je suis aller et je penses même le meilleur. Merci Guadalupe!!😊🇨🇦

Guadalupe is a fantastic host, making my fiancé and me feel right at home from the moment we arrived. She is passionate and highly knowledgable about the local area, with some great recommendations, catered to suit our interests. The windmill itself is stunning, and the private terrace, with spectacular views, is perfect for a couple wanting a private space with plenty of room. We’re already recommending to our friends!
The best host and stay I’ve ever had. This place is a must visit! Guadalupe helped us with drivers, dinner reservations, and everything in between. 10/10 stay!

We had the most wonderful time at the windmill. Guadalupe went above and beyond to look after us. All of the little details were so charming and we had everything we needed. We didn't have a car but it was so easy to get around via uber /bus. The outdoor kitchen is sublime. We'll definitely return! Jess & Mark

Wow! This was by far the best Airbnb we ever stayed at. Everything was perfect from Guadalupes warm welcoming and quick and clear communication to the location and amenities. The windmill is so beautifully renovated with an excellent eye for detail. The kitchen and bathroom is well equipped and there is an modern AC in the bedroom area that is very quiet so no problem sleeping with it on. We nerver had to use the other AC in the kitchenarea as the stone walls of the windmill are keeping it cool even when it was 32 degrees C outside. No problem walking down the road to town, it took us 10 minutes. We took a Bolt taxi home for under 4 euros. You can also take the car as there are parking spaces downtown. We enjoyed many of the local recommendations we got from Guadalupe. Would recommend anyone visiting the area to stay here!

We originally booked this Airbnb to be close to and visit comporta but ended up falling in love with setubal. Guadalupe is an excellent host. She was even able to find a place at the very last minute for my parents to stay right next door. Her windmill Airbnb is incredibly unique and has a historic feel but with all the modern amenities you could ask for. Blown away by her professionalism and willingness to help. Highly recommend booking this place you will not regret it. Also have to mention the view is absolutely breathtaking.

description.summary:
Let yourself be carried away by the romanticism of the Moinho do Marco!
Built in 1855, it is one of the few that still retains its original wooden gears. 
Enjoy the magic of sleeping comfortably in a mill full of history and charm.
Located in the Serra da Arrábida, let yourself be conquered by the tranquillity of nature from the terrace, which offers the best view over the beautiful Bay of Setúbal.

Enjoy this unusual, romantic and sustainable accommodation at any time of the year.
description.space:
The mill is arranged over 4 floors:

Floor 0: From the terrace you enter the living room with kitchenette.
Floor 1: The stone staircase leads up to the mezzanine, a space with a height of 1m50 where there are a couple of armchairs and a table with light, an ideal place to read, chat...
Floor 2: the same staircase leads up a few more steps to the bedroom, circular, with 3 windows with beautiful views.  The ceiling is conical and has a velux window with remote control.  The bed is placed under the original shaft and the original mill bed, separated by a light mosquito net.  It is air-conditioned.
Floor -1: from the living room on floor 0, you go down some steps to the bathroom, which is dug under the floor, in the rock, but it is very bright because it has natural light coming in through skylights in the ceiling.

Not recommended for people with mobility problems or for children/babies who have not yet acquired the ability to go up and down stairs.
description.access:
Private access to the barbecue.
They also have access to the washing machine room.
Private terrace with tables, chairs and sun loungers.  
Private sun shower in the garden.
No swimming pool.
description.notes:
Access to the space/accommodation is only allowed to persons included in the reservation. 
In order to maintain the privacy of the place, as well as the comfort and safety of our guests, it is totally forbidden to invite any external person.
Please read carefully the "Accommodation Book" to know how it works, which coffee capsules to buy, how to use the air-conditioning, where to put the rubbish, etc.
description.neighborhood:
Explore as magníficas paisagens e trilhos do Parque Natural da Arrábida. Visite as praias de areia branca e aguas cristalinas desde o Moinho do Marco.
Uma visita obrigatória a 5' de carro ao Mercado do Livramento para comprar peixe fresco, queijo, legumes frescos e conhecer as pessoas da terra, voltar ao Moinho e preparar o churrasco enquanto desfruta da vista e da brisa do mar.
A noite estrelada convida-lhe a relaxar no terraço e descobrir os sons noturnos da Arrábida.
description.transit: Nao existem transportes publicos por perto, mas o valor de um taxi desde o centro de Setúbal até o Moinho do Marco está por volta dos 5 €.
description.interaction:
The owner will hand you the keys to the accommodation and show you everything you need to know to enjoy your stay at Moinho do Marco, Setúbal.
Contact him to arrange your arrival.
description.house_rules:
Wi-fi: Tp-Link F9AD Password: 43521241

Thank you for reading the Accommodation Book upon your arrival, where you will find all the information you need to enjoy your stay with us.

To maintain the security and privacy of the owner and other guests, only the people included in the booking can access the property.

If you intend to receive any visitors, the owner must be informed in advance.  If accepted, the visitor should fill in a sheet with their details to be included in the insurance of the accommodation.  Price per visitor/day 20 euros.

There is only room to park 1 car inside the property.

Avoid leaving food waste both inside and outside the accommodation to avoid the arrival of ants, rats, flies, etc.   Rubbish bags should be placed in the buckets located inside the garage.

Vertical awnings on the barbecue porch should be left rolled up when no one is present. 

Before checking out check the following:
- Lights off
- Air conditioning off
- Towel warmer in the bathroom turned off.

name: Charming Mews House near Windsor Castle, London and Ascot
title: Englefield Green, UK

gallery.caption: This charming 1872 Grade 11 listed cottage is in the picturesque village of Englefield Green, 4 miles from Windsor Castle, 3 miles from Wentworth Golf & 6 miles from Ascot Racing. Heathrow Airport is 6 miles away & central London is 35 mins by train.

Built in 1872 this property was formerly owned by Baroness Cheylesmore and has been lovingly restored to offer contemporary, luxurious living space overlooking a beautiful gated courtyard with adjacent secure parking and gardens.

The Mews is just a stroll away from Windsor Great Park, 5,000 acres that was popular with Saxon Kings as a hunting forest. It is home Savill Gardens and lakes. Deer roam freely alongside the Great Walk, a majestic pathway that leads to Windsor Castle

Stunning 5* boutique cottage in 1872 Mews gated courtyard with fountain.  Private parking & garden.
2 bedrooms with high quality beds, goose down duvets & pillows, White Co bedding & products. A breakfast hamper with bubbles welcomes you on arrival.
Beautiful furniture and comfy Loaf sofa.
It's the little things that count. Plenty of kitchen towel, bin liners and tea towels, salt, pepper, olive oil, toilet rolls, soap and products. You will feel at home when you walk through the door.

The fully equipped kitchen features high quality appliances, including a dishwasher, washing/drying machine. We have a Tassimo coffee machine and also provide Arabica coffee beans, grinder and cafetiere.
Choose, from fresh coffee beans, grinder & cafetiere, Espresso machine or instant!
The cottage is full of interesting and quirky art.
The cottage has a private patio and you can enjoy the acre of private gardens.
We welcome you with a substantial hamper including a bottle of bubbles.
The kitchen looks into your private garden
Enjoy a comfy bed with White Company bedding and goose down duvets & pillows. Light and airy with lots of wardrobe space & original artwork.

The spacious bathroom is light and airy.
We provide White Company, shampoo, conditioner, bath and shower gel and hand soaps.
Lots of fluffy towels and White Company products will make your candle lit bath even more special.
The second bedroom has a double bed and wardrobe
Featuring the original arched window, this cosy bedroom looks into the Mews courtyard.

We own all the properties in The Mews and we have remained a Super Host for over 6 years. We have hosted 1000 guests and are consistently rated 5*. We are happy that we have many returning guests - one guest has accumulated over two years of stays.

hosts.about:
My name is Debi and we have hosted guests in The Mews for four years. The Mews was built in 1872 and we lovingly restored and converted it into five cottages and two houses in a private, gated courtyard with fountain. We provide the highest quality of comfort with sumptuous beds and White Company bedding, towels and products. We welcome you with a substantial breakfast hamper and a bottle of champagne. We live in a house adjacent to The Mews so we are always on hand to help out. I specialise in interior design and also develop properties with my husband David. We can give you great recommendations for restaurants, shopping, sites of natural beauty and attractions both locally and in central London.
We look forward to welcoming you!

name: Four Seasons Stonework Castle, Live the Fairytale.
title: Anatoliki Attiki, Greece

gallery.caption: Σαουνα
Ντουζ σαουνας/πισινας

all.name: No stairs or steps to enter

hosts.about:
My name is Maria. I live in Athens, Greece. I live there with my husband and my two sons. In 2002 we built a house in Saronida. It was our dream to live in an actual Castle, so we studied it with the best architects and we created a real Castle made out of stone and recycled materials. Hence the name Four Seasons Stonework Castle.
We lived there for 18 years. My sons grew up in this house as did we (me and my husband) so, after all these years, we decided to move to the city in order to have everything closer. That meant that we had to make something out of our dream. So instead of leaving it behind we thought it would be better if we shared our love and experience of the house of our dreams with other people. All that led us to turn it to a small business of our own while making other people feel the warmth and love that this house has given us.
After some years of experience I felt that this is something that I would like to do as an actual job so I began designing other houses and villas for rent in order to share my excitement of what I do and also help other people make a business out of their beautiful homes. 
I will love to be your host. In any house you choose to stay…

recent.comments: We spent our family vacation at Maria's stone castle and had an amazing time. We were looking for privacy and an amazing view, everything was as expected. Host is very responsive, highly recommended!

description.summary: At the heart of the hill of our town, we have created and decorated, a unique stone-built masterpiece with a stunning 270° view. Enjoy the breathtaking sunsets and have the most unique feeling and experience, while living in a mountain castle! The whole inner part of the house is decorated by us giving it a fairy tale feeling. An unforgettable sight and experience themed by all four seasons. Pool can be heated as well as cooled, with an extra charge and upon agreement with the owner.
description.space:
The property provides A/C in every room and a Central Heating System. It also has a fireplace to warm your nights.  
Bedroom description:
1) "HERMES"  one double (160cm width) + one single (80cm) + private wc w/bathtub
2) "APHRODITE" one double (150cm) +one single(90cm) + private wc w/shower
3) "ARTEMIS" one double (150cm), one semi double (120cm width) + a shared with nr 4 bedroom wc w/shower
4) "POSEIDON"  two single (90cm) + a shared with nr 3 bedroom wc w/shower
5) "DIONYSUS" one double  (150cm) +one single(90cm) + private wc w/shower + a full organized kitchen . This is a small house, independent from the main house.
The entire house can sleep 14 people in the bedrooms and 2 at the sofas by the fireplace.
There is one organised kitchen with two living-rooms and a full organized BBQ outside the house with a table for 8, another big table for 10 is outside with infinity view. 
The nearest beach is located only 3 minutes away also by car while there is a private pool with a whirl-pool, on the balcony of the property. There is also an open parking for two cars.
The whole inner part of the house will be decorated by us giving it a fairytale feeling. An unforgettable sight and experience themed by every season.
We can offer full time working employees providing you cleaning of the house, babysitting, personal training, dietician, personal driver and a tour-guide. Everything on extra cost.
Important Notice : This is a stonebuild house  that is able to withstand  the many Richter earthquakes !!
Enjoy our, full of surprises, hospitality.

description.notes:
The rooms inside the villa are accesible by  steps . Outside by elevator .

description.summary:
This studio is really charming, and have a lot of cachet ! located in the heart Bonnieux at less than 5 mn walking from all amenities (restaurants, shops...), you will enjoy the "Provençal way of life" during your stay. In the bedroom, you will feel away from the modern world standing below its 400 years old arches!
But you will have all the comfort of a newly renovated place with a separate entrance, your private bathroom, a wifi access, an equiped kitchen... You will enjoy having a drink and your meals outside on the terrace.
Important : For those willing to rent a larger place (up to 4 pax), we also rent a duplex apartment with a fully equipped kitchen. You will find this other listing named "charming duplex apartment" in my profile.

The studio is all yours. It's an independent apartment with its own private courtyard and entry door.

We always do our best to help our guests and to make sure that they have all what they need during their stay : booking restaurants, providing advices and tips about the area, where to go, what to do... 
We are always happy to talk with them and guide them trough their journey in Provence to make it a wonderful stay.

The studio is located in the heart of the Village of Bonnieux, in the foothills of the Massif du Luberon, 50 kilometers east of the mediaeval city of Avingnon. Shops, restaurants, and other amenities are within a 5-minute walk of the house.

It is possible to come to Bonnieux by Bus from Marseille (Marignane International Airport), Aix en Provence (TGV Station) or Avignon (TGV Station). 
However, the best option is definitely to rent a car.
We are close (1 hour drive) from Avignon and Aix en Provence (TGV stations), and Marseille (Marignane International Airport).
Lot of our previous guests were landing in Nice (around 3h away from Bonnieux) because there is a good choice of international flights.
You will find all relevant information about how to reach and contact us on the voucher.
Do not hesitate to ask if you have any further question or if you need anything.

We are living next door, so if you have any question, if you need anything or if you encounter any issue, don't hesitate to contact us.

hosts.about:
I would be happy to share with AIRBNB travelers the deep link with an original and living Paris that I have woven over time to build together with them a successful stay and in the image of their dreams.
As host, it is a privilege to welcome travelers from all over the world with whom I can communicate in terms of culture, tourism or gastronomy. Adhering to the motto "Living and letting live", my principle is to base my relationships on trust and respect for others. I sincerely appreciate all the enrichment offered by the diversity of meetings and exchanges in relation to the traveler. If I have chosen to share with you the unique atmosphere of the left bank, it is because I also consider that this unique neighborhood where students, artists and bourgeois Parisians meet well reflects what one imagines By far when you think of the atmosphere of Paris.
In the shadow of Notre Dame, which is the symbol of old Paris, I chose to share with you the beauty and comfort of this unique apartment on the banks of the Seine because its romanticism resembles me and is soothing in This world tormented to find simply on the occasion of a journey, the happiness of a place whose beauty will leave you forever unforgettable memories and you will finally understand why it is said of Paris that it is the "City of The Love "

Parisien de souche, je serais heureux de faire partager aux voyageurs AIRBNB le lien profond avec un Paris original et vivant que j'ai tissé au fil du temps pour construire ensemble avec eux un séjour réussi et à l'image de leurs rêves.
En tant qu'hôte, c'est un privilège que d'accueillir des voyageurs du monde entier avec les quels je peux communiquer en terme de culture, de tourisme ou de gastronomie. Adepte de la devise "Vivre et laisser Vivre", mon principe est de baser mes relations sur la confiance et le respect de l'autre. J'apprécie sincèrement tout l'enrichissement qu'offre la diversité des rencontres et des échanges en matière de relation avec le voyageur . Si j'ai choisi de vous immerger dans l'ambiance privilégiée de la rive gauche, c'est parce que je considère aussi que ce quartier unique où se côtoient les étudiants, les artistes et les bourgeois parisiens reflète bien ce que l'on imagine de loin quand on pense à l'atmosphère de Paris.
A l'ombre de Notre Dame qui est le symbole même du vieux Paris, j'ai choisi de vous faire partager la beauté et le confort de cet appartement unique en bordure de Seine parce que son romantisme me ressemble et qu'il est apaisant dans ce monde tourmenté de trouver tout simplement,  à l'occasion d'un voyage, le bonheur d'un lieu dont la beauté et l’originalité vont vous laisser pour toujours des souvenirs inoubliables et  vous comprendrez enfin pourquoi on dit de Paris qu'elle est la "Ville de l'Amour" !

recent.comments: This is the best place to stay in Paris.  The hosts are outstanding - so kind, helpful, and communicative.  The place is amazing- a landmark and site to see in itself!  The location is perfect!  We could not be happier and we can’t wait to stay here again!  Best rental we have ever had!

This AirBnB is in a great location - always my first criteria. Train from the airport drops you off a 6 minute walk away; from the place we were able to walk to everything! So many great places to eat and shop steps away. And the inside of the AirBnB is as cool as it looks online. Very clean and the bedrooms are very dark and quiet. We were there in August and it was always cool inside, I did see they have heaters on the wall in each room for the cooler months. Hosts were great with communication. We would certainly stay there again!
Loved this place!!!!!!  So beautifully and unique.  Such history. Alain was extremely helpful.
Great host!

Great location, communication, and comfortable beds. Incredible neighborhood-safe, bustling, and beautiful, but on quieter street.  Minutes from metros and airport train.15 minute walk to the Louvre, D'Orsay, etc. Best location in Paris. Hosts were communicative and helpful.  
BUT, so jammed with clutter that it is difficult to settle in- shelves and drawers are filled with books, knick knacks, even videotapes stacked behind toilet, limiting space to store or hang clothes, toiletries. The downstairs area (kitchen, dining) is a dank, damp cellar not especially habitable.  Much of the small kitchen space is occupied by 2 washers and a 2nd dishwasher that are not for renters. Only exit requires key, which creates potential "locked in" safety issue. 2 rooms separated by dividers and a light in one room illuminates the other, so not practical for renters with different bedtimes. Great location, greats hosts, maybe not great for a long stay.

Alain & Dora’s place is 2 story, ground floor apartment that’s unique and stylish. It was a great option for our family and super convenient and walkable to Marais restaurants and nightlife. The hosts were wonderful - proactive and communicative throughout our stay - we were also grateful for their willingness to accommodate an early check-in.

description.summary:
Discover the Paris of Artists
In an exceptional apartment on three levels in the rare historic environment of Quincampoix street in the heart of the Marais.
Come live and share the atmosphere of historic Paris, the unique experience of a dream holiday that combines both the charm of old stones, beams and original timber and the well being of modern comfort, like the Pompidou Beaubourg Cultural Center, which dominates the neighborhood with all its architectural power.
description.space:
Discover this exceptional apartment on three levels located in the rare historic environment of Quincampoix street in the heart of the old Marais de Paris
Quincampoix street is known to be the oldest street in Paris.
It dates from the 12th century and was first of all a place of trade and exchange between the clothiers from the East and the richest Merciers of Paris whose activity at the time was grouped around Notre Dame. It evolved to a place of walk for the Aristocrats and was at the origin of an upheaval of the royal finances when, in 1719 settled there John Law who created there the first World General Bank, which revolutionized the world of the businesses.
Come to live and share with family or friends in the atmosphere of historic Paris, the unique experience of a dream holiday in an apartment that combines both the charm of the old with its old stones, its beams , its original frescoes and half-timberings and the well-being of a modern comfort, like the Notre Dame de Paris cathedral and Pompidou Beaubourg Cultural Center which dominates the district with all its architectural power.
The place has been completely revisited by Parisian interior designers to be modernized and functional while respecting the nobility of its original building materials, renovated with high-end ecological materials by Parisian craftsmen.

gallery.caption: Senza tema di smentita, questo è uno dei bagni più ampi che si possano trovare a Parigi.
Sotto casa c'è un'ampia scelta di ristoranti esotici.
L'appartamento si trova in un tipico stabile Haussmannien.
La TV a schermo curvo ad alta definizione tiene alta la bandiera della tecnologia e aggiunge toni moderni all'atmosfera del loft.
Il divano letto è solo un esempio della scelta di design contemporaneo presente nel loft.
Oltre a un cestino di benvenuto troverai una bottiglia di vino per assaporare al meglio il tuo soggiorno.
Dietro il banco del bar si nascondono il frigorifero, la piastra a induzione e la lavastoviglie.
Un buon caffè espresso ti darà la carica giusta per una lunga giornata a Parigi.

hosts.about: Let us introduce ourselves:  are Carmen and Mauro. We live and work in Italy and we like to spend free times in one of our properties in Venice, Paris, New York. Moreover we love to exchange our properties with any interesting proposal everywhere in the world. We are fond of vacation rental and home-exchange.

Sono un ingegnere con la  passione per l’architettura. Lavoro a Venezia dove sono cresciuta e ho studiato. Vorrei avere una casa in ogni città dove mi piacerebbe vivere. Il vacation rental ci aiuta  a pagare i mutui delle case che io e mio marito abbiamo acquistato in alcune delle città più belle del mondo  (Venezia, Parigi, Roma, New York) per godercele noi nel tempo libero e condividerle con i nostri ospiti per il resto dell'anno.

description.summary:
Airy loft-like apartment in a typical "Haussmannian" historical building.
The Capital of fashion, food, art, music, culture, history is waiting for you! You will be only a few steps from great restaurants, theaters, cinemas and, of course, nightlife. 5 Underground and RER lines will take you from home to everywhere in Paris. It sleeps up to four people.
description.space:
At the 1st floor, located in the 2nd Arrondissement, in the very center of the "snail" in Paris. Very close to main attractions (2 minutes from Opera Theatre, 6 minutes from Place Vendome, 10 minutes from Madeleine Square, 15 minutes from Louvre Palais, 20 minutes from Beaubourg, etc.). The apartment has been recently and finely refurbished but preserves the fascination of the unforgettable "belle epoque." Entirely equipped and furnished for four people with a queen-sized bed plus a sleeper sofa for two. The floor and the ceiling are authentic and antique. Old beams, old parquet and logical living designs and amenities create charm and space that feel good and are just plain fun to live. 
This huge one bedroom open space with separate kitchen is ideal for new life style. Loft living is different: "A loft is an open space and creative use of that space that invites people to arrange things to suit their lifestyle and taste." The great part is that the owner decides the use-of-space, not the builder! The main attraction of the apartment is a sprawling bathroom with big Jacuzzi tub and shower. Finally very rare in Paris: both the kitchen and bathroom have their window.
The building is on a quiet street between two "Grand Boulevards." Anyway, the apartment is completely soundproofed to allow you a quite sleeping. The location is in a lively area to stay in, with splendid buildings and palaces such as the Palais Royal surrounded by gardens and restaurants, the "Bourse" stock exchange, the Louvre, the Tuileries Gardens. The rue St Honoré runs through the middle of the first arrondissement with small boutiques from end to end as far as "Chatelet Les Halles" a popular tourist attraction.
Are you a lover of food? You cannot miss places like Fauchon, Andruet.
 Are you at home-design passionate? Lalique, Baccarat, Habitat and many shop and exhibitions are waiting for you. 
Are you looking for Cinema, Theatre, International Restaurant? There are many just a few steps from the apartment.
Are you at home-design passionate? Lalique, Baccarat, Habitat and many shop and exhibitions are waiting for you.
description.access: Everything is available for our guests: the wifi, the stereo and our classical music selection, cable TV, Nespresso coffee machine and its original capsule selection, etc. Only the chest in front the bed and the Bibliotheque are forbidden, where owner belongs are stored.
description.notes: You will feel like at home and you will find everything you need !
description.neighborhood:
Unlike other centralized districts, the 2nd arrondissement boasts no major tourist attractions. But it’s exactly this void of guidebook fodder that allows a more nuanced and authentic Paris to surface, providing a veritable paradise rife with discoveries for the initiated flaneur. Here are some notable addresses to get you started.
Coffee: If you believe that a good cappuccino is always a good idea, go to Lockwood (73 rue d'Aboukir). Matamata Coffee Bar (58 Rue d’Argout) provides similar deliciousness.
And for a shocking third suggestion: Starbucks. Not for the coffee this time but for the ambiance: the location at 3 Boulevard des Capucines is set in a former aristocratic salon with shimmering chandeliers and grand painted ceilings.
Shopping: To add a splash of panache to your purchasing, go back to the source—literally—with the covered passages of Paris. Considered the prototypes of today’s shopping malls, these artificial streets offer a glimpse back into Paris’ peak of chic. Galerie Vivienne is high-end fashion mixed with antique books and home decoration. The cozy Passage des Panoramas serves up a string of local eateries and collector’s shops, while Passage Choiseul puts on a daily spectacle of non-touristy, authentic local life.
For a completely different experience, a stroll up Rue Montorgeuil is a must with its market-style atmosphere of butcher shops, florists, and cheese mongers. Paris’s first bakery, Stohrer (51 Rue Montorgueil), is a perfect slice of historical sweetness.

Wine: The 2nd arrondissement is a veritable mecca for wine lovers, with no fewer than four tasting addresses within two blocks from each other. Legrand Filles et Fils (1 Rue de la Banque) has specialized in wine since the 1880s and upholds a grand tradition in the area. Its sleek and sophisticated bar offers up to 14 wines by the glass and over 3,000 bottles for sale. For a more informal vino vibe, head just down the street to Aux Bons Crus (7 Rue des Petits Champs) or Willi’s Wine Bar (13 Rue des Petits Champs). Another locally-loved address is a cork’s throw away at Verjus (47 Rue de Montpensier).

Restaurants: Of course the best lunch values are where the locals are, and you’ll find plenty of them: the  unpretentious Dédé la Frite (52 Rue Notre Dame des Victoires); Les Bols de Jean (2 Rue de Choiseul) and a bit more formal "Le Galopin" (Place de la Bourse). All of them serve traditional French dishes like blanquette de veau.

For something more fun and family-friendly, try a pizza at Victoria Station (11 Boulevard Montmartre) where the dining rooms are recreations of steam locomotive train cars.

History: As one of the oldest arrondissements, the 2nd has oodles of juicy history to savor as well. Tip your hat to the glory days of debauchery in front of the former address of Le Chabanais (12 Rue Chabanais). This nondescript office building was once the most famous and lucrative bordello in Europe and hosted a revolving door or princes, presidents, and dignitaries. Rooms decorated in the style of Pompeii, India, the Middle Ages and even Versailles made it famous around the world. The brothel’s kinkiest client, King Edward VII of England, famously enjoyed champagne baths in the company of several of his…female companions. Toulouse Lautrec celebrated the "Le Chabanais" in almost his paintings, and that was the time of its maximum glory.
description.transit: You can reach on foot the most interesting sites to visit: the Louvre is 10 minutes walk, Madeleine Square 12 minutes, Place Vendome  7 minutes, Palais Royale 10 minutes, Chatelet Les Halles 20 minutes, Latin district 20 minutes, the Marais 20 minutes, etc. If you prefer public transportation, you can choose among 5 underground lines, 7 bus lines, and the RER. Even tourist bus "hop on hop off" start from Opera Square. Finally, the shuttle to Charles de Gaulle airport leaves near Opera Square.

name: Confort y modernidad de estilo industrial cerca de plaza Cataluña
title: Barcelona, Spain

all.name: No stairs or steps to enter

recent.comments: Fantastic location and great apartment!

items.comments: Fantastic location and great apartment!
Great place, just as describe, friendly reception who had lots of recommendations. El Market next door is great for tapas.

Best place we stayed at during our 3 week European trip, and quite possibly of all our stays ever! Excellent communication prior and during our trip with very wonderful, nice and accommodating staff. The room was immaculate, and the high ceilings made the already large room feel even more spacious and luxurious. Our kids enjoyed the rooftop pool every day.  The location is within walking distance to the Born and Gotic neighborhoods, while also having public transport nearby should you need it. We will not hesitate to stay here again the next time we are lucky enough to visit Barcelona!

This was a great location in Barcelona. Easily walkable to restaurants, attractions and metro. There were 4 of us staying, which would be a little tight for a long stay but worked out well for 2 nights. Nice to be able to do a load of laundry.

The place was fantastic - super clean and friendly front desk person. Not much of a view from the room itself, but the rooftop pool made up for it and then some. The Bluetooth speakers were a nice surprise, but the TV didn’t have any streaming apps. Walkable to great restaurants and bars. Would highly recommend.
I’ve stayed at midtown apartments 3 times now and highly recommend. Extremely clean, nicely decorated and excellent pool. Never disappoints. Super easy and slick check in.

description.summary:
El apartamento está ubicado en un edificio exclusivamente compuesto por apartamentos, el Midtown Apartments.
Nuestro apartamento de 1 Habitación y 1 Baño, puede albergar un máximo de 2 personas.
Amplio y  lujoso apartamento, con su propia personalidad. Exterior, con balcón y una gran luminosidad, que le proporcionaran la calidez y comodidad de un segundo hogar.

Mini market (con cargo extra).
Servicio de conserjería.
Terraza solárium con piscina comunitaria. Horario de la piscina y la terraza : 9h a 20h.
Consigna.
Parking (con cargo extra)
Wifi gratuito.

Asistente personal y conserjería de 9h a 20h.Horario de la piscina y la terraza : 9h a 20h.

L'Eixample, barrio emblemático donde se alberga este exclusivo apartamento de estilo urbano y moderno, situado a pocos minutos de los principales puntos de interés turísticos y culturales de la ciudad.

Para llegar a Midtown Apartments desde el Aeropuerto de Barcelona:
Taxi: El coste aproximado es de 35€.
Aerobús: El coste por persona es de 5,90€. Puede tomar el Aerobús a la salida de cada Terminal del aeropuerto y debe bajar en la última parada: Plaza Cataluña. Los apartamentos están a 200 metros, subiendo por Paseo de Gracia y girando a la derecha por la misma calle Casp todo recto hasta llegar a los apartamentos.
Tren: El tren sale cada 10 minutos de la estación del aeropuerto y son unos 35 minutos de trayecto hasta la estación de Passeig de Gràcia. Midtown Apartments se encuentra a unos 750m de la salida de la estación.

Transporte público cerca de Midtown Apartments Barcelona:
Metro: Dispone de 3 paradas de metro cercanas a los apartamentos: Urquinaona L1, Passeig de Gràcia L2 (salida Gran Vía) y Tetuán L2.
Bus: Diversas líneas de autobús tienen parada en la Gran Via cerca de los apartamentos: 7, 50, 54, 62 y H12.
Bus Turístico: La parada más cercana está en plaça Catalunya a menos de cinco minutos andando.
Bus Nocturno (sólo funciona por las noches): N1, N2, N3, N9 y N11.

Los apartamentos disponen de parking en el mismo edificio.

description.house_rules:
NORMATIVA DE CONDUCTA / ESTÁNDARES DE CONVIVENCIA

Horarios
Entrada: A partir de las 15h00.
Salida: Antes de las 11h00.

Atención al cliente presencial: 9h00 a 17h00

Atención telefónica para emergencias 24h.

Tasa Turística (NO INCLUIDA EN TARIFA)
A partir del 1/11/2012 ha sido aplicada una tasa municipal de 0,72€ por persona y noche que deberá abonarse al realizar el check‐in. Máximo de 7 noches. Menores de 17 años exentos. (Ley 5/2012, de 20 de marzo, del DOGC)

El cliente siempre deberá avisar de la hora aproximada de llegada. En el caso que la llegada sea más tarde de las 18:00, se le proporcionarán las debidas instrucciones para tener acceso al apartamento reservado.
Es condición indispensable avisar como mínimo 2 días antes de la hora de llegada.
El huésped que realice la entrada después de las 18:00 se compromete a personarse en recepción el día siguiente de su llegada para proceder con el registro y pago del total de la estancia (en el caso que no estuviera prepagada).  El acceso al apartamento se verá limitado a partir de las 11:00 si no ha pasado por recepción para revalidar sus llaves.

Número de huéspedes
Sólo las personas registradas podrán tener acceso a los apartamentos. No se podrán alojar más personas de las permitidas por capacidad. Si se detecta que hay personas alojadas que no han sido registradas previamente, Midtown Apartments se reserva el derecho de anular la estancia completa de los clientes, sin derecho a devolución del pago ya realizado.

Comportamiento
Hora de descanso:   De 21:00 a 9:00.
No están permitidas las fiestas, ni en los apartamentos ni en las zonas comunes. Respeten el descanso de los otros huéspedes y vecinos, y no hagan ruido a partir de las 21:00. En caso de no seguir esta directriz Midtown Apartments se reserva el derecho de anular la estancia completa de los clientes, sin derecho a devolución del pago ya realizado.
Queda totalmente prohibido fumar en todo el edificio. Sólo estará permitido fumar en la zona de la terraza. En caso de incumplimiento de esta directriz se cobrará un plus en concepto de limpieza extra de cortinas, sofás, etc. La misma fianza será aplicada en caso de introducir animales domésticos, los cuales no son bienvenidos.
No se aceptan mascotas.
Si necesita guardar bicicletas, pregunte al recepcionista dentro del horario de atención al público. No se permite subir bicicletas a los apartamentos ni depositarlas en zonas comunes. 

Responsabilidad
Por su propia seguridad asegúrese que la puerta principal quede bien cerrada a su llegada o salida del apartamento. La dirección no se hace responsable de la pérdida o daño de los objetos personales no depositados en la caja fuerte (hasta 600€).
Le pedimos que haga un  correcto uso de los electrodomésticos de su apartamento, no introduzca objetos metálicos en el microondas.  Por favor apague el aire acondicionado, luces y aparatos eléctricos cuando abandone el apartamento, y no utilice el aire acondicionado con las ventanas abiertas. Asimismo le agradecemos un uso responsable del agua; intentamos reducir al máximo el impacto medioambiental. 
Le recordamos que la potencia eléctrica en España es de 220V. Asegúrese que los aparatos eléctricos que utiliza soporten dicha potencia, la dirección no se hace responsable de cualquier daño que produzca un mal uso de éstos aparatos.
Póngase en contacto inmediatamente con nosotros en caso de que se haya producido algún desperfecto o accidente en el apartamento para poder solucionarlo lo antes posible.  Tenemos personal de mantenimiento que se encargará lo antes posible de repararlo. Por favor no intenten arreglar ningún electrodoméstico por su cuenta, ustedes serán plenamente responsables de cualquier desperfecto derivado de esto. Tampoco nos responsabilizamos de cualquier accidente derivado de la manipulación de objetos eléctricos o similares.
Quejas
Midtown Apartments no hace en ningún caso responsable de acontecimientos ajenos a la empresa como pueden ser:
-  Ruido ocasionado por obras próximas a la vivienda reservada.
-  Ruido ocasionado por otros huéspedes del alojamiento.
-  Avería del servicio de internet por causas ajenas a los apartamentos.

Deposito de garantia reembolsable
Se pedirá un depósito por daños de EUR 250 a la llegada. Se efectuará con tarjeta de crédito. El depósito se devolverá por completo mediante tarjeta de crédito una vez revisado el alojamiento.

Limpieza
Mantenga las zonas comunes limpias.
Se realizará 1 limpieza en estancias superiores a 1 semana cada 7 días.
El cliente podrá solicitar limpiezas extra durante la estancia (según disponibilidad del servicio de limpieza y con coste adicional).
Apartamento 1 Dormitorio  - 45€
Apartamento 2 Dormitorios  - 70€
Apartamento 3 Dormitorios  - 85€
El día de la salida, el cliente deberá dejar la vivienda en condiciones aceptables de orden y limpieza. Midtown Apartments  tendrá derecho a cobrar gastos adicionales de limpieza cuando la vivienda no esté en condiciones aceptables, así como de los posibles desperfectos ocasionados.

Seguridad
El edificio cuenta con un circuito cerrado de cámaras de seguridad con vigilancia 24h. Éstas están ubicadas en las zonas comunes (entrada, pasillos, escaleras, ascensores, piscina y pasillo), nunca en los apartamentos.

Este servicio de vigilancia 24 h es para su seguridad y la de los otros huéspedes. En caso de cualquier incidencia o desorden público, un equipo de guardias jurados tomaría las medidas pertinentes para asegurar el descanso y tranquilidad de todos ustedes.  Midtown Apartments se reserva el derecho de anular la estancia completa de los clientes, sin derecho a devolución del pago ya realizado.

Información personal y protección de datos
En cumplimiento del artículo 5, apartado 1.a), de la Ley Orgánica 15/1999, de Protección de Datos de Carácter Personal, informamos al cliente de que los datos de carácter personal que se nos faciliten se incorporarán a un fichero debidamente inscrito en el Registro establecido a tal fin por la Agencia de Protección de Datos, y servirán para la eficaz prestación de los servicios que usted ha contratado. Sólo aquellos empleados y proveedores que deban conocer tales datos en orden a la prestación de dichos servicios tendrán acceso a los mismos. En cualquier caso, el cliente puede ejercitar los derechos de acceso, oposición, rectificación y cancelación previstos en la mencionada ley.

name: Colosseum Elegant Vibes Apartment
title: Rome, Italy

hosts.about:
Hello and welcome. 

My name is Noelle. I am from Toronto, Canada. My partner Giorgio is from  Naples, Italy. We have 2 children and we live in beautiful Rome! We love to be active whether it’s out sightseeing or riding our bikes always respecting nature. We love to cook and watch films also. 

We are avid travelers and have stayed in Airbnb’s all over the world. We have taken this knowledge and applied it to our hosting business. It’s wonderful meeting new people from all over the world. 

We would like to make your stay in Rome as enjoyable and stress free as possible. We hope it feels like your home away from home! Your onsite host is Jay and he is available to you 24/7 for any questions or concerns. 

If you are travelling with children or have special needs let us know how we can make your stay more comfortable. We are happy to help. 

We look forward to meeting you and welcoming you to the eternal city. 

Best,
Noelle

recent.comments:
Great stay overall. If your plan is to walk to the colosseum, trevi fountain, and forum areas, it’s perfect. Taking a taxi to the Vatican was easy. Walking to and from Roma Termini was a 12 minute walk MAX and with luggage not very difficult. 
Having access to a washing machine was a godsend. Truly. 
The place overall was very clean, roomy, and felt private. 
Be sure to bring your own hair conditioner, that’s truly my only “advice”. 
Stop looking, book now.

description.summary:
Located in Via Urbana, Monti district, a 5 min walk from the Colosseum. 1 floor above street level. A mix of modern and elegant design, Italian craftsmanship and Roman history (antique walls from the 17th century). Washing machine, A/C, WiFi, Netflix and vertical SPA system.

The unit is 480 sq feet, elevator,  in a quiet building. It is divided into three spaces: living area with kitchen/sofa bed, bedroom, bathroom, small balcony.  Check in from 15:00.  You may drop off your bags from 10:30.
description.access:
