If the apartment is ready before 1 PM, the check in can also be anticipated; in any case if you need to leave your luggage in custody, we will help you. 

Every guest must provide a valid identity document to be recorded as established by the law. The data of our guests are treated in accordance with current privacy legislation.
description.neighborhood: Monti is well known as the most vibrant, charming, artistic, cultural, and creative district. It is also a strategic place for tourists who want to discover Rome. The Colosseum is just a few minutes' walk, as well as access to the Cavour Metro stop.
description.transit:
Source: Article from "The Guardian" - Sunday 27 April 2014: 

Monti is central Rome's secret urban village. Tourists dutifully tick off the Colosseum, the Quirinal hill, the imposing Santa Maria Maggiore basilica, but tend to ignore what lies between them, assuming "there's nothing to see" – and so missing out on one of the city's most charming old residential neighbourhoods.
 
Once this was the Suburra – a crowded inner-city district nestled right up against the Empire's centre of power, and eventually divided from it by a long wall, designed to protect the Forum from the regular fires that would break out in a district colonised by craftsmen, chancers and sex workers. Today its ochre-washed houses on cobblestone lanes are prime real estate, inhabited by architects, trust-fund screenwriters and other well-heeled creative types. But despite the gentrification, Monti retains a bohemian edge, and has become one of Rome's most rewarding areas for alternative fashion, gourmet street food and alfresco cafe culture....
 
Begin the day with a cappuccino, either in one of several cafes that surround the area's central hub, Piazza della Madonna dei Monti, where dog walkers congregate and flirt with each other around the plain Renaissance-era fountain. This ivy-covered charmer has to be one of the most photographed houses in Monti; it's also one of the oldest, dating back at least to the mid-15th century....
 
The steep lane that marks the western edge of Monti – it begins life as Via Tor de' Conti, then becomes Salita del Grillo – is one of Rome's most characteristic. As you climb, check out the views of the Forum to your left. In Piazza del Grillo, halfway up, pan around to take in Rome's glorious layer-caked history: in one sweep you get a baroque palazzo incorporating a medieval tower and a Renaissance house belonging to the Knights of Malta, plonked on top of a ninth-century abbey that itself was built into the ruins of the 1st-century BC Forum of Augustus....

In 2007 one of Rome's architectural ugly ducklings, the 19-century Palazzo delle Esposizioni, a huge cultural centre, emerged from five years of restoration work looking externally still its bombastic neo-classical self, but with luminous new spaces inside, a rooftop restaurant and, most importantly, the remit and resources to stage some worthwhile middlebrow exhibitions – such as the one on Pasolini's Rome that runs until 20 July. For blockbuster shows to match those staged by London's Royal Academy or the Guggenheim in New York, you'll need to head a couple of blocks west to the Palazzo's classy sister venue, Scuderie del Quirinale, which has recently tussled with such greats as Titian, Vermeer and the Emperor Augustus. 

With aperitivo time approaching, you're spoiled for choice as Piazza della Madonna dei Monti is one big open-air bar these days. If it's authenticity you're after, head for Ai Tre Scalini at Via Panisperna 251, a bottiglieria that has changed little since it opened in 1895. Regulars spill out of the ivy-draped doorway and chat over glasses of Italian craft beer or new-style Frascati wine.
 
The Monti movida has taken off in the past few years, with a raft of gastronomic and nightlife openings. Among those most likely to stick is multi-tasking cafe, cocktail bar and restaurant Urbana 47 (Via Urbana 47), which marries commitment to Italy's new "fresh, organic, zero-kilometres" food mantra with very cool, vintage-chic interior design in a warren of rooms. One room is a small cinema –regular screenings are organised with film-matched food and wine pairings. They segue from breakfast through to nightcaps here with panache, but the place is buzziest around dinner time, when you can tuck into dishes such as ricotta-and-herb-stuffed ravioli on broad-bean purée with toasted hazelnuts. With a decent bottle of wine (and they have quite a few), expect to pay around €40 a head for two courses and a shared dessert.
description.house_rules:
CHECK IN:  This is a private apartment and it has no reception.  If you have booked the apartment, it means that you have agreed with the standard check in time (from 3 PM). 

CHECK OUT: The time is 10AM. It is important to respect this time as we need sufficient time to sanitize the apartment and make it available for a new check in. 

REGISTRATION Every guest must provide a valid identity document as stated by Italian law.. The data of our guests are treated in accordance with current privacy legislation.  
 
RULES OF CONDUCT When you're in the building common areas please be respectful of your neighbors' serenity.  In general: it is prohibited any activity that is contrary to the Italian laws. Please let us know at time of booking.

CARE OF THE APARTMENT We ask that you take care of the apartment as if it is your own. 

ENERGY SAVING The apartment is equipped with every comfort. It has hot water and heating supplied by the gas boiler. 

RECYCLING In the center of Rome the garbage is differentiated and thrown on selected days. If your garbage is becoming full and you're not sure what to do with it, please contact your host. 

LAST BUT NOT LEAST ... Have a wonderful Italian holiday!

Thank you

name: Caratteristico appartamento romano affacciato su Piazza di Campo de’ Fiori
title: Rome, Italy

hosts.about:
Hello, nice to meet you -:) 
My name is Maria.
I was born in a little country on the sea in the South of Italy but I live and work in Rome since 2015 and I am a lawyer.
I like little houses and I don't like empty spaces.
I like pets and I have got a dog. His name is Babbo.
I love the sea and all marine life, but also, in winter, I like skiing with my parents.
I like cooking, especially home cooked meal with a glass of good wine.

recent.comments: This apartment was beautiful and in an amazing location. Maria was always responded quickly to any question we had. 10/10 would recommend staying here!

items.comments: This apartment was beautiful and in an amazing location. Maria was always responded quickly to any question we had. 10/10 would recommend staying here!

This was the perfect place to kick off our Italy trip. It was situated in a great area with a bakery, restaurants, and a daily market, all while stilly feeling private enough to relax.
Also - the history of this amazing 500 year old apartment was definitely a plus.

Only thing that could have been improved was the air conditioning. It wasn’t able to properly cool down the apartment at times. Granted, it was one of the hottest weeks of the year…. It was hard to escape the heat pretty much anywhere.

This was our 2nd stay with Maria.  She is very responsive and helpful with recommendations.  She went the extra mile and even arranged our transport from the airport.  We love staying with her because the location is perfect to all the sites and everything you need is just a few steps away.  Great shopping close.  She is ver accommodating and waste no time to respond to you.
Cute place located in a wonderful area surrounded by restaurants and within walking distance to all the main attractions! The place looked exactly as pictured, we had a wonderful stay.

Excellent location! Spacious and lovely apartment with lots of character. We visited during an extreme heatwave and the AC struggled to keep up at times but under normal circumstances I'm sure it would be more than adequate. Would definitely recommend!
Great location, beautiful apartment!

description.summary:
(ATR - 011880-6)
Immergiti nella suggestiva atmosfera di un appartamento dal gusto classico impreziosito da dettagli rustici: ammira le travi a vista, lasciati sorprendere dall’antico pavimento, goditi il calore del camino e l’intensa luce che penetra dalle finestre.

The apartement is perfectly situated in the heart of Rome. It has one large bedroom, a spacious living/ dining room, a well equipped kitchen and a bathroom. There is a spectacular view of Piazza Campo dei Fiori from the bedroom windows.
The flat is a 5 minutes walk from Piazza Navona and it is ideal for a couple or family who would like to go sightseeing in this beautiful town.
It's a no - smoking house.

Entire apartment.

Svegliati con il profumo dei cornetti sfornati dal più antico forno di Roma, varca il suggestivo portone e, dopo una passeggiata nell’affascinante piazza, lanciati nell’esplorazione dei più celebri luoghi cittadini e della dolce vita romana.

L'appartamento si trova a soli 4 minuti a piedi da piazza della Chiesa Nuova, dove si può usufruire del servizio taxi h 24.
Su corso Vittorio Emanuele ci sono tre fermate degli autobus (linea 64, 70 e 14) che vi consentiranno di raggiungere facilmente i principali luoghi di interesse artistico e culturale e le principali vie dello shopping.
Inoltre a 3 minuti a piedi ( su Via Giulia) troverai un parcheggio a pagamento,custodito e video sorvegliato 24 ore su 24.

In my apartment you will find a selection of 3 wines from different regions of Italy.
Upon booking, you have the option to purchase an additional "wine" package. You can tell me which region of Italy you prefer for wine (e.g. Lazio, Umbria, Toscana, Veneto, Sicilia ...) and I will specially select three wines for you and have them  waiting in the apartment upon your arrival. If you don't know or prefer any regions, then I can choose three wines from this region to give you a truly Roman experience! Then, just tell me which bottle (s) you opened/drank and I will tell you the price to pay me for each. I hope to make your holiday even more special!
In the morning you can wake up to the smell of fresh baked croissants and biscuits from the oldest bakery in Rome.

name: Sissinghurst Stables, In the Heart of the Garden of England
title: Kent, UK

gallery.caption: The Stables have their own private, east facing, dog proofed garden.
The under cover area by the front door is a good place for storing wellies or bicycles or sit and put your waking boots on.
There is a comfy sofa in the kitchen looking out over the terrace.
There is a comfy sofa in the kitchen area as well as a separate one for children in the TV room.
Botanical and garden influenced pictures through out.
We leave local flowers and gifts depending on the season.
Dahlias from my neighbours flower farm when in season.
Flowers from the garden.
There's fast fibre Wifi and a small table to use if you need to work while away.
There is a view to the garden and terrace from the kitchen and a comfy leather reading chair.
Kitchen table with flowers from the garden.
Flowers from the garden or from my neighbour who grows Dahlias.
A very comfortable Kingsize bed.
Botanical decor and Sophie Conran Lamp bases.
Plain bedlinen for older children.
A bunk room with a small double on the bottom, this room has a mezzanine floor with toys for the children
We make the room suitable for all age children with plain duvet covers for the older ones.
A large overhead rain shower and a luxuriously deep bath.
Quirky country design.
Enjoy the convenience of a separate loo.
There's a separate T.V. room with Netflix & Amazon Prime for rainy days.
The Stables have a calming, botanical, countryside theme.
There's an undercover table tennis table by the front door.
The double doors lead on to the garden terrace.
A small Webber BBQ for your use.
The private terrace has a table with rattan chairs, a BBQ and a washing machine in a small shed through the green gate.

We do as much as possible to be environmentally friendly, refillable washing up liquid, hand soap, hand lotion, shampoo and conditioner, air drying the linen, using local produce and recycling as much as possible.
The garden is mainly left to encourage wildlife and mown in the middle for somewhere to play.
For muddy dog walks.
So much to see and do for both adults and children.
The Stables are up a long gated driveway behind the main house.
You will have your own dedicated parking space with room for two cars right outside the front door.
A magical pace to spend Christmas.
The pretty vegetable garden from the main house.
The vegetable garden.
A natural country Christmas.
A living Christmas tree by the front door.
Stockings for the grown ups too!
A magical space for Christmas.

hosts.about: We are a family of 5 and enjoy an active outdoor life, walking, cycling, riding, sailing and skiing. We love cooking and especially sea food. We live in the countryside and love an open fire and a good movie too!

recent.comments: We had a lovely week at The Stables. The cottage was tastefully decorated and well kitted out. Emma and her family are lovely, friendly and helpful and made us feel very welcome. Highlights were the vases of beautiful locally grown flowers, the mezzanine floor in the kids’ bedroom and the visiting badger!

items.comments: We had a lovely week at The Stables. The cottage was tastefully decorated and well kitted out. Emma and her family are lovely, friendly and helpful and made us feel very welcome. Highlights were the vases of beautiful locally grown flowers, the mezzanine floor in the kids’ bedroom and the visiting badger!

This place was just what we needed, we rented The Stables for a month, Emma and Gareth where very helpful and went out of their way for us, and were accessible at all times.
The Stables was a little gem out in the countryside offering peace and tranquility, however the place offers good Wifi and even Netflix 😊 It is immaculate and Emma and Gareth left a little welcome pack. 
There is loads to do in the surrounding area although a car is needed. 
Definately recommend a visit and I will be back.

We had a great time at The Stables. Emma is a brilliant host, who responds very quickly to messages, and gave us all the information we needed to have a great holiday in Kent. The area is lovely, great walks, good pubs, plenty to see and do, and the accommodation was very good indeed. It feels safe and secure (down a private gated driveway) and peaceful. We found The Stables very clean and tidy, there was plenty of space for our family of 5 and it is well equipped with everything you need. It was always nice and warm, with enough hot water for a family. The pictures are accurate and the garden was great for our dog. Emma has thought of everything, there's even a hose, dog bath and towel outside (it was very muddy underfoot on footpaths through woods and fields). She had even left us all personalised decorations hanging on the Christmas tree! Thanks for a great time, Emma, we hope to come back one day!

Our experience was great from start to finish. We stayed from Dec 23-27th, but we contacted Emma in October, and her communication is perfect. We have children aged 4 and 2, and Emma provided a travel cot and microwave. She also researched the local pubs for us as we planned a Christmas Day lunch. We were also granted leeway with check-in due to the kids naps. Emma’s mother adorned the accommodation with Christmas decorations, and even put our names on ornaments hung on the tree. The accommodation is clean, spacious and the mezzanine above the kids’ room had boxes of toys that our children loved. We had a very minor issue with the heating and power not coming on, but all was needed was a flip of the switch on the boiler and fuse box. Emma’s husband Gareth popped round to do this. The issue never occurred again, and I was impressed with their consideration. I highly recommend staying at The Stables. My family and I had a wonderful time there and Emma and her family are amazing hosts!!
Very nice and cosy place to stay! Emma was very friendly and always very helpful.

Beautiful place for a break away, particularly well setup for kids with an amazing play room filled with toys. Emma is a super host and even sent suggestions for a rainy day when the weather was bad on one of the days. Would highly recommend!

description.summary:
Sit and enjoy the large private garden from the sunny east-facing terrace. This rustic home has an authentic feel, with a quirky calming country design, interspersed with antique furniture and botanical artwork throughout. It is only one hour from London by train which makes it a perfect location for a city trip. 

Insta:
Sissinghurst_stables_airbnb

The Stables has Fast Fibre broadband and 4G, Netflix and Amazon Prime are available, along with a Nespresso coffee machine.

Dogs are welcome as long as they are house trained and well behaved. The garden is dog proof for medium sized dogs.

Deep cleaning takes place between each stay and we operate self check in.

Stays during July & August are for seven nights only.

The property is single story. There is a King size bed in the master bedroom and a bunk bed with a double bed on the bottom in the second bedroom. 
There is a fridge with a small freezer compartment, cooker with a hob, a toaster and a kettle.

The Stables is located at the top of a long drive and sits behind the main house. You will have your own private car parking space and there is room for two cars if required. There is quite a large private garden for your use.

Please feel free to text or call us prior to your trip for any special requirements or questions. We will (usually) also be on hand during your stay for any further information or guidance. But will leave you in peace if that is your desire!

The Stables are in the village of Sissinghurst surrounded by National Trust Properties, with the renowned Sissinghurst Castle Gardens just down the road. Chapel Down and Hush Heath vineyards are a short drive away and we have a fantastic local pub ‘The Milkhouse’ a beautiful ten-minute walk away through woodland and over a small river (which does get muddy during winter). Central London is just one hour on the train which takes you directly to Charing Cross via London Bridge and Waterloo, there is parking at Staplehurst Station.

Car is the easiest way to get about to see local attractions but there is a local bus that goes to Tunbridge Wells and Tenterden and a train station 10 mins away with a direct train into London Charing Cross (45 mins).

We have two friendly dogs that may make themselves known.
description.space:
The property is single story, accessed by a front door tucked into the corner of an undercover area which is handy to store bikes or walking boots etc. There is a table tennis table here too.

The hallway has space for coats and shoes and leads onto the kitchen area which also has a sofa area looking out onto the garden and terrace. There is access to the fenced garden from here. There is a fridge with a small freezer compartment, cooker with a hob, a toaster, a kettle and Nespresso coffee machine.

There is a King size bed in the master bedroom and a bunk in the second bedroom. There is also a fold out single mattress for a third child on the mezzanine floor if required.

You’ll find a washing machine through the garden behind the stables in a little shed.
description.access: The Stables is located at the top of a long drive and sits behind the main house. You will have your own private car parking space and there is room for two cars if required. There is a large private garden for your use.
description.notes:
Deep cleaning takes place between each stay but we are trying to be travel sustainable so use earth friendly products where possible, air dry linen and leave a couple of local treats for your arrival. 

We have two friendly dogs that may greet you in the driveway.
description.neighborhood: The Stables are in the village of Sissinghurst surrounded by National Trust Properties, with the renowned Sissinghurst Castle Gardens just down the road. Chapel Down, Hush Heath and Benenden vineyards are a short drive away and we have a fantastic local pub ‘The Milkhouse’ a beautiful ten-minute walk away through woodland and over a small river (which does get muddy during winter). Central London is just one hour on the train which takes you directly to Charing Cross via London Bridge and Waterloo, there is parking at Staplehurst Station (10 minutes in the car). We are also close to two great beaches, Camber Sands and Winchelsea, Rye and Hastings. Canterbury and Whitstable are not too far either. Leeds, Bodiam and Dover Castles are all worth a visit!

🌳 If you are bringing a dog please don’t leave them unattended. 

🌳 Please don’t move the furniture around.

🌳 Please be respectful of guests in the main house.

🌳 No parties or events.

🌳 When checking out please make sure that the washing up is done, that the general rubbish is put in the green wheeley bins in the driveway and that the paper/card and hard plastic is separated and put in the green boxes in the under cover area.

Thank you!

name: Fiquet, havre d'élégance et d'histoire
title: Rouen, France

hosts.about:
Après des études juridiques, j'ai travaillé de nombreuses années dans le secteur des assurances.
 J'ai été particulièrement intéressée par ces études qui favorisent la réflexion, un esprit analytique, ainsi qu'un certain sens de la "contradiction".

Après diverses expériences professionnelles enrichissantes, je me suis orientée vers le secteur touristique qui me permet d'assouvir mon goût pour le contact. La richesse de ces rencontres avec des invités de toutes régions et de toutes nationalités, me comble et m'instruit.

Je suis passionnée par la nature, qu'il s'agisse de la faune ou de la flore. Les animaux domestiques sont également toujours présents dans mon univers. Les chevaux tout particulièrement, que j'aime et ce, depuis l'enfance.

Je suis aussi particulièrement intéressée par l'histoire de France, berceau des évolutions de notre  société, ainsi que par son architecture si riche.

Enfin, transmise par ma Mère qui en était férue, la décoration a toujours  été très présente, voire obsédante dans ma vie. La création et la vie, dans une ambiance, une atmosphère chaleureuse et confortable, sont indispensables à mon bien-être.

Ce que je recherche en tant qu'hôte pour mes invités, c'est qu'ils puissent se sentir immédiatement comme chez eux, mais ailleurs. Je décore et aménage mes logements, comme je voudrais moi-même y vivre.

Voilà, en quelques paragraphes, le résumé de qui je suis.

Alors, à bientôt!

Appartement magnifique et très bien décoré. Haut dessus d’une place assez animée mais une fois les fenêtres fermées on entend plus rien. Proche de tout ! Arrivée très facile et bien expliquée. Hôte très réactive et a donné de bons conseils pour visiter la ville (notamment le show de son et lumière qui se déroulait durant notre séjour). Nous reviendrons sans hésiter.

This is a perfect location for taking in the major sites. Bar outside could get noisy, but the windows shut out all the noise. it was a hip place and very comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.

Amazing place in the city center of Rouen. Christine is very responsive and friendly 
We had an amazing stay there 
Apartment is very well furnished and organised 
We feel like at hold
A very cost space and a great host!

Bel endroit, très propre et en cerise sur le gâteau… des livres ! Mais aussi une literie impeccable ainsi que des serviettes épaisses et moelleuses ! 
Je recommande !

description.summary:
Posez vos valises dans ce sublime appartement d'un hôtel particulier du XVIIIe siècle. Vous vous y sentirez immédiatement comme chez vous, grâce à sa décoration cosy chic à l'esprit vintage. Entièrement équipé, il permet d'accueillir 2 voyageurs.

Après être monté au second étage par un escalier monumental, il sera temps de reposer vos jambes fatiguées par vos multiples expéditions. Avec une vue sur la majestueuse Abbatiale de Saint Ouen, vous pourrez trouver la quiétude d'un nid bienfaiteur vous offrant tout le confort d'un appartement de 32 m2, refait à neuf, et totalement équipé.

Le logement est intégralement dédié à nos invités.

Christine ou Dominique seront présents pour vous accueillir de façon chaleureuse et décontractée. Vous pourrez ainsi vous sentir à l'aise et sereins, après parfois de longues heures de trajet.
Si vous le souhaitez, nous pourrons vous indiquer les bonnes adresses ainsi que  les divers sites à visiter. Vous serez donc fins prêts pour monter à l'assaut de la ville.

Niché au cœur du vieux Rouen avec ses ruelles médiévales et ses maisons qui défient les lois de l'équilibre, l'appartement vous permettra de profiter des nombreux bons restaurants, bistrots et coquettes boutiques situés à proximité.

Le trajet entre la gare de Rouen rive droite, et l'appartement s'effectue en une dizaine de minutes à pieds. 
Si vous arrivez en voiture vous pouvez  stationner votre véhicule, au parking de l'Hôtel de Ville à quelques mètres de l'appartement en sortant à  "Voies piétonnes ( Il faut compter 15 Euros par tranche de 24h). 
Un autre parking à environ 8/9 minutes existe également pour le même tarif : Palais de Justice ( sortie piétonne "Cathédrale). Ce parking est beaucoup plus propres, plus grand,  et les places sont plus spacieuses.
Sinon, le stationnement peut s'effectuer dans la rue, avec temps limité et horodateurs. Le stationnement dans les rues est gratuit de 19h à 9h ainsi que le dimanche et jours fériés. Au bas de l'immeubles des vélos sont disponibles à la location. Enfin, les transports en commun par bus sont à quelques minutes.

Sous réserve de nous l'indiquer à l'avance, le check-in peut s'effectuer 24/24 sans aucun supplément de prix

hosts.about: I believe in providing the same friendly, efficient service I like to receive when I am travelling.

recent.comments: Gary’s apartment was lovely a real gem in the middle of Warwick, spotlessly clean and very spacious for a one bedroom place. I will definitely visit again when I’m the area!!

Lovely clean place with easy access to Castle, restaurants etc. 
great setting , good Wi-Fi , TV and kitchen. 
Would have been 10/10 but for noisy patrons of the lovely pub a few doors down ( I didn’t mind 😂).  
Would go back for sure. 
Make sure you book the better restaurants beforehand as they are busy.

This place was lovely, cosy and well presented. It was very central to places in Warwick and near some lovely restaurants.  The flat was very clean, great comms from Gary and the spiral staircase made it a special place

Gary had thought of everything, it was well-laid out, had character, there were nice decorative touches, the table was laid (with knapkins!), the instruction book covered everything, noone else lives in the building,  access to the town/shops etc is simple, parking overnight and on Sundays is easy. Towels and bedding very good. Excellent base - book it!

We have stayed for just a weekend in Warwick and I have to say- it couldn’t have been better place for us. It was a combined leisure/work trip for us and with amount of things we have to organised already at the very last minute we have been surprisingly pleased with how easy Gary has made it for us. Before the stay we got the message with all essential informations and he has checked with us on the day of arrival just in case we have all the location details etc. (which was very helpful especially when you travel straight from work).
The location of the place is simply Central! It can not be any closer to all what this city has to offer. Simply pack you bags and ENJOY! 

Bed sheets are extremely soft and you will sleep like a queen/or king. We love the style and how the place is designed. 

Perfect place for a weekend getaway.

Ps. If you like to cook there is no need to worry as you will find all the essentials here. Including spices :)

description.summary:
Look out over the Old Square and St Mary's Church, and ascend the spiral staircase to the bedroom for views of the castle. Pale chevron wood floors are pleasingly contrasted with dark-metal features such as the chandeliers, banisters, and bedstead.

Fully refurbished, the original high ceilings, large bright windows and parquet flooring have been enhanced with luxurious furnishings . The kitchen, at the rear of the property overlooks manicured gardens and is fully equipped including an espresso coffee machine. Free unlimited Wi-Fi is included, and there is a Smart TV for viewing your own Netflix account, BBC IPlayer etc. A spiral staircase leads from the lounge up to the bedroom and en-suite shower room. The bedroom has views over rooftops to the Castle beyond.

The apartment is ideal for a romantic getaway, a history filled sightseeing trip, or when travelling on business in the area. There is plenty of parking nearby, local car-parks, just 3 minutes walk away charge £4.50 for 24 hours.
 
Warwick is a lovely market town in the heart of England. The apartment is within walking distance of the medieval Warwick Castle and the beautiful historic church of St Mary. Shakespeare's Stratford is a short drive away with its RSC theatre and other attractions.

Note: The Apartment is accessed up one flight of stairs. There is also a narrow spiral staircase within the apartment leading up to the bedroom and bathroom.

I am always happy to answer any questions or advise on great places to eat, drink or visit in Warwick. In the apartment you will find itineraries of things to do, with 'insider knowledge' to help you get the most out of your visit. Suggestions range from canal side walks, historic places to visit, best restaurants and bars, and even where to hire a classic car for the weekend!

** Corona Virus Information ** 
If you are traveling for business and wish to make a June booking please send us an inquiry. 
In line with Government advice for us all to stay at home we are unfortunately not able to accept holiday bookings until 4th July. We operate a flexible cancellation policy, if you make a booking but are unable to travel, you will receive a full refund. Additional cleaning routines are now in place to disinfect door handles and o

Step out to an abundance of excellent bars and restaurants, all part of the appeal of this historic market town. Walk to the medieval Warwick Castle, which hosts regular historical re-enactments, while Shakespeare's Stratford is a short drive away.

EV charge points are available at the nearby carpark.

We operate a flexible cancellation policy and you will receive a full refund if you have to cancel your booking.

name: Meltemi Windmill—Iconic Landmark Offering Stunning Views
title: Míkonos, Greece

hosts.about: Having lived in Mykonos for many years, i have developed a good understanding of Mykonos Town and the surrounding area. The island is a very special place and has provided me with great moments and adventures throughout my life.  There is  an indescribable energy around this place that only those who inhabit here and visit can understand.

recent.comments:
Abbiamo soggiornato nel mulino con i miei figli adolescentii, un'esperienza indimenticabile
Tutto bellissimo 
Grazie Alexander

items.comments:
Abbiamo soggiornato nel mulino con i miei figli adolescentii, un'esperienza indimenticabile
Tutto bellissimo 
Grazie Alexander

ABSOLUTELY STUNNING and AMAZING location! THE iconic windmills seen in every photo of Mykonons! So lovely inside, nice cooling air conditioning, comfortable beds and couches, and perfect bathrooms plus FULLY stocked kitchen. Be aware though, if you DON'T like lots of people and activity going on around you, then choose another location! HOWEVER, you'll then miss out on one the most spectacular places you could EVER stay in Greece! We LOVED leaning out the windows and waving to people as they took hundreds of photos of "our" windmill then seeing many surprised faces as they realized people were residing inside! Oh, and those sunset views - WOW! Apt within walking distance of EVERYTHING! Extremely attentive Host, always available, and provided our transportation too!
What a unique and fun experience! Loved everything about it.
Staying in one the iconic Windmills of Mykonos was perfect.  It was our family’s second stay.
Our stay was great! Beautiful location.

MAGICAL place
If you find this place on your dates - BOOK IT - i actually changed my itinerary and dates just to stay here and it was worth it
First - You are staying inside a Landmark - but Its practical, liveable and perfect from the inside
Perfect 2 bedrooms with attached bathrooms along with another loo in the living area
Bedrooms have comfortable Beds and Linens and towels
Kitchen is big and nice n well equipped
Living room is perfect
Views are prefect (pls note the windows inside the home are small so view is limited) but once u step out its AMAZING
Location - you are in the quiet with 2 mins walk to all the Action
The BEST restaurants, bars, shops, taxi stand, supermarkets - nothing is more than 5 mins away
This place is a little expensive but WORTH every penny
LOVE IT - stay here - its MAGICAL - cant imagine a better 2 bedroom in all of Mykonos!

description.summary: Take breath-taking sunset pictures of Little Venice waterfront from this elevated property, itself one of the island's most photographed sights. The rounded interior makes for a unique experience, with the thick walls ensuring peace and quiet.
description.space:
From as early as the 16th century one of the most recognized icons of Mykonos have been the windmills. Indeed they have regularly been described as one of the most popular monuments of the Cyclades islands and, their picture as a trademark travelled all around the world.

Situated in the heart of Mykonos Town 'Chora', Windmill Meltemi offers breathtaking waterfront sea views of Little Venice and the surrounding area.

Guests are treated to the best views of the famous Mykonian sunset from Meltemi's spacious terrace on Windmill Hill, where hundreds of tourists gather every day to enjoy this magnificent spectacle.

GUESTS:
Meltemi boasts considerable space and comfort with a large sitting room to entertain friends/family. It's thick walls block any external noises and it's 'rounded' interior design makes for a unique experience.

Each bedroom has it's own en-suite bathroom, air conditioning and netflix television.
The Living Room contains a 40" television and a stereo sound system together with Bluetooth/aux input.

We do not mind people having friends/family visiting during their stay - parties, loud music or any behavior that would draw attention to your stay from our neighbors, the super or landlord are strictly prohibited.

name:
Sherry Loft. Feel Jerez. Parking.
Bodega s.XVIII. Maridaje de lo antiguo y nuevo
title: Jerez de la Frontera, Spain

location.address: Jerez de la Frontera, Andalucía, Spain

gallery.caption: Zonas comunes cuidadas

all.name: No stairs or steps to enter

hosts.about:
Somos Leo y Fernando.
Nos gusta mucho viajar con nuestros hijos. Solemos hospedarnos en apartamentos turísticos porque nos dan independencia y adoptamos ese espacio como nuestra casa. Disfrutamos preparándonos el desayuno en familia y planeando el día con un montón de folletos sobre la mesa. Estar de viaje, pero sentirnos en casa y ser parte activa de la ciudad que visitamos.
De estas sensaciones y experiencia partió la idea de ofrecer un espacio para los visitantes y viajeros. Hacer sentiros que estáis en casa y disfrutar de nuestra preciosa ciudad como un jerezano más. Y en esto estamos...

recent.comments: Great place!

items.comments: Great place!

This is the best Airbnb I’ve ever stayed in. The space is absolutely beautiful and has everything you need. My partner and I wanted a home base while we explored andalucia for a week, and this was perfect. Great spot for two, lots to do in town that you can walk to plus not far in driving distance to a lot of other things. Leo also provided a lot of recommendations and they were all great, she is super friendly. If you’re doing more than just Jerez, I suggest renting a car.
Amazing stay in a great location in Jerez, very well hosted by Leona. Highly recommended!

Wir hatten einen wunderbaren Aufenthalt in dem tollen und liebevoll eingerichteten Apartment von Leona. Leona ist super freundlich und hat uns gleich mit wichtigen Tips und Empfehlungen (Strand, Restaurants etc) versorgt. Die Lage ist hervorragend, sehr ruhig und gleichzeitig ist man schnell in der Altstadt. Die Einrichtung und Ausstattung des Apartments ist hervorragend und mit sehr viel Liebe zum Detail. Vielen Dank für diese schöne Woche :)

Great location near the bodegas and short walk into town. Lovely quiet courtyard to relax in. Very clean and comfortable with great aircon. Kitchen area was small but well equipped. We stayed a week and cooked most evenings. Leonarda was great telling us lots of local recommendations including where I could do my early morning runs (Torrox lake). I Recommend a visit to Arco de Frontera and Vejer de Frontera - both pretty hilltop towns and Tarifa and it’s nearby Roman city of Claudio Baela. Cadiz and Seville are not far to drive to also.

This is a lovely apartment in a fabulous building.  We really loved the outdoor space in the beautiful courtyard.  It was great to have parking so close to the Jerez city centre, and the air con in the apartment was appreciated.  Leonarda is a thoughtful and very responsive host.  Highly recommended.

description.summary:
Apartamento para adultos y niños MAYORES DE 7 AÑOS. NO FUMADORES.
El Loft se ubica en una bodega jerezana rehabilitada del siglo XVIII.
Es un espacio diáfano bellamente decorado y completamente equipado.
Está situado en primera planta con ascesor y cuenta con una terraza amueblada de 20 m2 bajo los soportales del patio en planta baja. 
Es un lugar muy tranquilo para desconectar y disfrutar de la paz y el silencio en un edificio histórico.

Loft diáfano con garaje. Cocina completa y electrodomésticos, comedor, salón, dormitorio y cuarto de baño con ducha.  
Aire acondicionado y calefaccion. El sofá puede hacerse una cama de 1,60 cm de ancho. 
Aparcamiento seguro dentro de la bodega incluido en el precio.
Espacio propio acondicionado en soportales del patio a tu disposición: lectura, tomar algo, una copa...

Loft, aparcamiento y patio de la bodega

Cualquier cuestión, estaremos encantados de ayudaros.

Enclavado en pleno centro, en el barrio de San Mateo y cerca de la antigua Plaza del Mercado y del Museo Arqueológico, podrás relajarte paseando por sus tranquilos alrededores a la vez que descubres rincones turísticos con encanto dignos de postales.

A 10 minutos andando, siempre en un entorno histórico, se puede acceder al antiguo Ayuntamiento, la Catedral, zona de bares y restaurantes, tiendas visitas a bodegas...
A 50 metros está la parada de autobuses "Puerta de Rota" donde paran las líneas 2, 8 y 9 que cubren cualquier zona de Jerez.

La vivienda está equipada con pequeños electrodomésticos en la cocina como cafetera Nespresso, cafetera de filtro tipo Melita, tostador de pan, hervidor de agua (kettle). Además del desayuno (incluido en el precio) se ofrece sin cargo capsulas de café, café molido para cafetera con filtro, bolsitas de té, infusiones, cacao y leche; además se aportan consumibles básicos como son servilletas, aceite, vinagre, sal, azúcar, papel de cocina, aluminio...
El loft dispone de artículos de limpieza y consumibles como son los jabones de lavavajillas y lavadora. 
En el cuarto de baño está equipado con una calefacción de aire caliente de 2.000 W, secador de pelo, secador de toallas de barras en la pared y otro portátil para secar alguna prenda o calentar toallas. Se equipa con champú y gel.
Hay medicamentos y productos básico de botiquín.

description.house_rules:
Por las caraceristicas del loft y su decoración no se permite freir pescado. La antigua bodega donde se sitúa el loft, cuenta con zonas comunes de tránsito y acceso. Estas zonas, especialmente el pasillo de acceso al loft,  deben mantenerse libres de objetos personales, como zapatos, o cualquier obstáculo.
El patio común donde se sitúa la terraza del loft,  es un espacio privado de tranquilidad. Está prohido entrar en las terrazas del resto de los vecinos y hacer fotografías de sus zonas privadas. Es muy importante mantener una relación respetuosa con el resto de los habitantes del inmueble.
No es una zona de juegos, ruidos o fiestas. La pérdida de llaves tiene un coste de 100€

recent.comments: We had a wonderful stay at Manuel’s vila. Gorgeous surroundings and the villa was incredible, great for large families as it has many bathrooms and rooms. The kitchen has all that is needed for cooking and the overall amenities are great (especially the pool!). Manuel was great and provided all that was necessary for our stay.

items.comments: We had a wonderful stay at Manuel’s vila. Gorgeous surroundings and the villa was incredible, great for large families as it has many bathrooms and rooms. The kitchen has all that is needed for cooking and the overall amenities are great (especially the pool!). Manuel was great and provided all that was necessary for our stay.
Lovely for families. Wonderful hikes around the local mountains.

Very welcoming host. House extremely clean and beautifully decorated.

Great outdoor eating area.

Easy to get around in the region with Sitges and Barcelona 30 minutters away
Amazing place! We really enjoyed our week in Manuels house. The place is very spatious and great for a larger group. Communication was excellent and check-in went very smooth. Highly  recommended!

El lugar es más hermoso de lo que se ve en las fotos. Manuel responde súper rápido y fácil de comunicar con el. Todo excelente , es ideal para pasar unos días en familia o celebrar alguna ocasión especial como en nuestro caso muy recomendable. Volveremos algún día  seguro.

We were family meeting up from New Zealand, Singapore, UK and Sweden so this beautiful large villa with lots of space for everyone to spread out was perfect. Beautiful courtyard for lunches and dinners. Good restaurant 1 minute away and small supermarket. Good distance from Barcelona and Sitges for beaches and lots of restaurants. Manuel was the perfect host and went out of his way to help and assist. He was amazing.

description.summary:
El aire puro entrando por sus ventanales, sus vistas de escándalo, sus atardeceres junto a la piscina, su rústica decoración cuidada hasta el más mínimo detalle... Todo esto y mucho más en un alojamiento excepcional con piscina y barbacoa para viajeros en busca de paz.
A 28km de Barcelona.

Situada en una tranquila zona residencial de Vallirana, en el Penedés, cuenta con la ubicación ideal para disfrutar de la naturaleza en su estado más auténtico, realizar rutas senderistas, practicar ciclismo de montaña o acampar al aire libre.

Recomendamos alquilar coches.

Importante: al tratarse de espacios muy amplios, el wifi sólo llega a algunas partes de la casa.

Situada en una tranquila zona residencial de Vallirana, en el Penedés, cuenta con la ubicación ideal para disfrutar de la naturaleza en su estado más auténtico, realizar rutas senderistas, practicar ciclismo de montaña o acampar al aire libre. En tan sólo 30 minutos puedes llegar a las playas de Sitges, a Barcelona o al aeropuerto del Prat-Barcelona.

La casa dispone de un sistema de alarma con volumétricos detectores de presencia (no grava videos ni fotos ni sonidos) y solo funciona con la alarma conectada.
